title: Senior SEM specialist
description:
#### **OM SCREAM**


Scream är Sveriges ledande oberoende mediebyrå. Vår vision är att göra det enkelt att skapa framgångsrik kommunikation. Vi arbetar med många av Sveriges största varumärken och vi har vunnit åtskilliga priser i flertalet branschtävlingar under åren. Scream drivs av ett engagerat och lokalt entreprenörskap, med missionen att utveckla och inspirera såväl medarbetare som kunder. Vi har tre kontor i Sverige, över 140 anställda och vi är en del av Media Family.


#### **ARBETSBESKRIVNING**


I rollen som Senior SEM-Specialist kommer du in på en dynamisk och snabbfotad arbetsplats där du får möjligheten att arbeta med några av Sveriges största varumärken. Du kommer snabbt inta ett stort ansvar och få en nyckelroll i kundarbetet samt ges möjligheten att arbeta med större utvecklingsprojekt.


Du kommer ingå i flera olika kundteam, arbeta flexibelt och pendla mellan både strategiska och operativa uppgifter. Detta kommer att göras för både mindre och större komplexa kunduppdrag och ditt ansvar kommer bland annat innefatta att utveckla, optimera och underhålla kampanjer för kunderna. Det förväntas att du, tillsammans med dina kollegor, utvecklar långsiktiga och framgångsrika samarbeten med kunder i alla sammanhang samt identifierar och agerar på möjligheter att utöka kunduppdragen.


**I dina arbetsuppgifter ingår:**

* Ta fram strategier och rekommendationer till kunderna som inte nödvändigtvis begränsas till kanalvalet
* Proaktivt arbeta med att förbättra och utveckla annonseringen med en stor förståelse för kundernas övergripande mål
* Presentera resultat, insikter och planer på en kundnivå som motsvarar mottagarens.
* Delta i pitcher för större kunder och hålla utbildningar, både internt och externt
* Proaktivt söka efter information för att hålla dig uppdaterad om nyheter inom mediabranschen
* Identifiera och testa tekniska hjälpmedel för att automatisera och förbättra arbetet

#### **DIN PROFIL**


Vi söker dig som har en stor affärsförståelse av digital marknadsföring samt goda analytisk- och problemlösningsfärdigheter. Vidare ska du kunna identifiera möjligheter som utvecklar och effektiviserar arbetet och i samråd med Head of Seach vidareutvecklar avdelningens produkterbjudanden.


Den rätta kandidaten har en bred kunskap kring orsak och verkan i köpplattformer, kan utveckla en djup förståelse för diverse aspekter i digital media och har stor kunskap kring externa verktyg samt tjänster som används för att effektivisera annonseringen och därigenom identifierar ytterligare möjligheter att växa kunduppdrag.


Du är en konsultativ och relationsinriktad person som upprätthåller kundrelationer och identifierar och agerar på nya kunduppdrag. Vidare är du strukturerad, prestigelös och teamorienterad då vi levererar vårt resultat som en grupp.


För att lyckas i rollen som SEM-specialist förväntas du:

* Ha en relevant utbilding inom ekonomi, marknadsföring eller media
* Besitta minst 2-3 års erfarenhet av sökmotorsannonsering från liknande roll/roller. Meriterande om du har tidigare erfarenhet från mediebyrå.
* Ha goda kunskaper i Google Ads, Bing Ads, Google Analytics, och gärna andra mät- och analysverktyg, samt bid managementverktyg för sök
* Vara väl bekant med- och kunna säkerhetsställa att Scream är up-to-date inom aktuell teknisk nivå för området (Mätning, Shopping, Automatisering, Feedhantering, Script, Attributionsmöjligheter och liknande)
* Besitta goda kunskaper inom Excel och Powerpoint
* Ha god skriftlig samt muntlig kommunikationsförmåga i både Svenska och Engelska
* Vara kommunikativ och trygg i rollen som presentatör, både mot arbetsgrupp och kund


Inom gruppen finns experter i SEO, CRO samt UX som du kommer arbeta i nära samarbete med, därav krävs strategisk förståelse för disciplinen och dess samspel med SEM. Slutligen, för att trivas och lyckas hos Scream är det viktigt att du delar passionen att vilja utveckla och utmana dig själv och bolaget och att du uppskattar en föränderlig och dynamisk miljö med korta beslutsvägar.

**HOS OSS FÅR DU:**


En stark, positiv och inkluderande kultur som smittar av sig i kundarbetet. Vi är en organisation med högt i tak och involverar personalen i alla former av projekt och beslut. Scream är kollektivavtalsanslutna och erbjuder bland annat pension enligt ITP1, lunchsubvention genom Rikskortet och förmånligt friskvårdsbidrag. Kontoret är vår huvudsakliga arbetsplats men vi erbjuder flexibilitet i arbetet med möjlighet att arbeta upp till två dagar per vecka hemifrån.


Jämställdhet och ett arbete för ökad mångfald är självklarheter hos oss. Hos oss finns oändligt många karriärvägar, vi är en oberoende byrå som utvecklas med och av våra medarbetare.

#### **ÖVRIG INFORMATION**


Rekryteringen hanteras av Bunch of buddies. Ansökan och kontakt sker till anna@bunchofbuddies.se

title: UX Designer
description:
**Work with us towards a greener future**
-----------------------------------------

  

  

Climate change is a reality. As a mobility provider, we recognise our impact on the environment and are determined to play our part in contributing to sustainable solutions. And it’s so exciting – we’re well on our way on our journey towards full electrification. If you share our commitment for creating a positive environmental impact, then join us in our mission to advance towards a greener future.

  


**What you'll do?**
-------------------

  

As a UX Designer in the Car UX team, you will work on defining and building a safe and effortless experience for our users, to make the car their own through different driving functionalities and controls. Your responsibilities will include identifying problems to be solved, mapping out desirable and feasible solutions for our users through e.g. utilizing user journeys and prototyping that balance design aesthetics with intuitive functionality.


You will collaborate with other designers and ensure a seamless customer experience across Volvo’s digital landscape. And as part of a product team, you will communicate designs, ideas, and rationale with your team using data and customer insights.


As a designer you advocate for the user, you will develop a deep understanding of our customer needs and pain-points, serving as an expert for your product team and develop ideas for new and enhanced features.


Your focus will be in developing technically informed and people focused hypotheses and designs on how to humanize the way to present driver centric information to our users. Your bread and butter will be to understand and untangle complex technical functionalities and requirements and structure them in a clear and glanceable way to our users. You have strong design skills and a track record that demonstrates how you create and build on top of existing design systems.


**Who you are?**
----------------


* You’ve been designing for 3+ years for a consumer-focused tech company, so you understand what it takes to create elegant, consumer-oriented experiences.
* You know that appropriate design solutions come not from a brief or a focus group but rather from the deep understanding of our users, their context and the challenges created by technology within that context.
* You are a versatile designer who uses a full range of skills—product design, interaction design, and visual design or prototyping — to ensure you deliver magical experiences to the customer.
* You are a strong collaborator, who can work with not only design partners, but many other stakeholders from engineering to marketing.
* You’re a strong communicator who can inspire teams towards action and empathy for the user.
* You have a people-focused design mentality. Constantly looking to hone your design instinct through user feedback. Whether that’s hands-on user research or a quantitative A/B test.

  




**What’s in it for you?**

  


Volvo Cars is on an ambitious journey to redefine what it means to own a vehicle during one of most innovative times in the transport industry. Volvo Cars is looking to redefine all aspects of the car eco-system including ownership, autonomous driving, vehicle electrification, sustainability and online shopping. User Experience as a discipline is a key part of Volvo Cars' strategy and a newly formed UX organization will help gather insights about our user's and redefine and elevate the users experience of Volvo's products and Services.

  


We are seeking for a UX Designer to expand our Driving Experience team, A team whose goal is to understand and evaluate all legal, technical, local and ambient information streams and vehicle specific functionality to create the best strategy and execution for a safe and naturalistic display and control of information.

  



**Ready to Take the Next Step?**
---------------------------------

  

  

Please submit your application through our career page. Due to GDPR regulations, we’re unable to store or consider applications from other platforms. Make sure to submit your application in English.


If you have any questions about the recruitment process, you are welcome to reach out to Amrita Namboothiri at amrita.namboothiri@volvocars.com.

  



**Volvo Cars – driving change together**
-----------------------------------------

  

  

Volvo Cars’ success is the result of a collaborative, diverse and inclusive working environment. Today, we’re one of the most well-known and respected car brands, with around 43,000 employees across the globe. At Volvo Cars, your career is designed around your skills and aspirations, so you can reach your fullest potential.


And it’s so exciting – we’re well on our way on our journey towards full electrification. We have five fully electric cars already on the market, and five more on the way. Our fully-electric and plug-in hybrid cars combined make up almost 50 per cent of our sales. So come and join us in shaping the future of mobility. There’s never been a more rewarding time to play your part in our inspiring and creative teams!
company_description: At Volvo Car Group, our vision is clear: "To be the world's most progressive and desired premium car brand".

title: Function Implementation Leader at Volvo Cars
description:
**Imagine the mobility of tomorrow**
------------------------------------

  

  

Picture yourself in an exciting industry where the future revolves around leading-edge electrified and self-driving cars seamlessly integrated into people's daily lives. But how can we create this future in a way that is both safe and sustainable? This is just one of the inspiring questions we're working to solve here at Volvo Cars. Join us and watch your ideas shape the future of mobility.

  


**Who we are**


The FAIT team aligns and coordinates function development throughout the product development phases supporting with function content and implementation. The FAIT team leads and organizes the work with function architecture and function implementation of new and/or updated functions, aligning Use cases and Product Definition Contexts. This work is done in close cooperation with Function developers from all units, UX team and different stakeholders, such as program management and product validation.

  

  

**What You Will do**


If you enjoy working with the complete product affecting the full consumer experience, this could be something for you! You will work with all our new customer functions from start and follow how they grow over time. We always start from the user perspective and are a part of the department that is responsible for validation from a consumer value perspective.


Your main focus will be to help the organization to align around the function implementation plan for Customer functions and their Use cases.  

You will…  

..be responsible for tracking Customer function and use case status and functional growth on a complete vehicle level.  

..play an important role from start of programs together with BPD, architects and function owners by setting the content and time plans.  

.. cooperate with Business, Base product development, Program Management and other units to deliver excellent user experience and keep track on agreed changes.  

.. be a “go to person” for function implementation for all stakeholders.  

.. build a wide network within the company

  


**What you will bring**


As a person, you like to work in all stages of product development with the complete product in mind. You love working with our products and are very good at engaging people throughout the entire organization. You are open minded with high focus on delivering a product that exceeds our customers’ expectations. You have a holistic/strategic understanding and flexible mindset rather than getting stuck in details and you have the ability to put the customers’, products and your team’s needs first without prestige.  

Qualifications and experiences  

* Experience from managerial positions or from leading technical task on Unit, Solution or Project management.
* Deep knowledge from at least one technical area within Automotive, e.g. electrical, mechanical or attributes.
* Good knowledge of VPDS and the phases/gates.
* Experience from SW development processes
* Good knowledge of user demands and usage of our products.
* Knowledge about functional development
* Ability to quickly become a “go-to-person”
* Experience from developing methods and processes
* You have a broad network within the company

**Ready to Take the Next Step?**
---------------------------------


Please submit your application through our career page. Due to GDPR regulations, we’re unable to store or consider applications from other platforms. Make sure to submit your application in English.


If you have any questions about the recruitment process, you are welcome to reach out to Recruiter Sanghamitra Deb at sanghamitra.deb@volvocars.com. For specific questions about the position, please reach out to Hiring Manager Rasmus Gyllen at rasmus.gyllen@volvocars.com.

  

  

Once your application is successfully submitted, you’ll receive a confirmation email. Applications are open until 24th of November 2024. We’re excited to get to know you!

  



**Volvo Cars – driving change together**
-----------------------------------------


Volvo Cars’ success is the result of a collaborative, diverse and inclusive working environment. Today, we’re one of the most well-known and respected car brands, with around 43,000 employees across the globe. At Volvo Cars, your career is designed around your skills and aspirations, so you can reach your fullest potential.


And it’s so exciting – we’re well on our way on our journey towards full electrification. We have five fully electric cars already on the market, and five more on the way. Our fully-electric and plug-in hybrid cars combined make up almost 50 per cent of our sales. So come and join us in shaping the future of mobility. There’s never been a more rewarding time to play your part in our inspiring and creative teams!

title: UX Designer
description:
Who we are:  

  

At Tobii Dynavox, we empower people with disabilities to do what they once did or never thought possible. We call this mission Power to Be You. Our assistive communication technology helps our customers express themselves, connect with the world, and pursue independence, whether through everyday activities like ordering food or extraordinary feats like running a company. Working at Tobii Dynavox, you’ll become part of a team that spans the globe, with offices in the US, Sweden, France, the UK, China, and beyond.  

  

To learn more about what we make possible, meet some of our customers or take a look at some of our products.  

  

What you’ll do:
We make touch and eye tracking based assistive technology for people with communication and mobility challenges. The success of our products has life-changing impact on our customers. Our Research & Development Team develops the hardware, software, and other technology that makes that impact possible.
We’re on the lookout for a UX Designer with a strong passion for accessibility and design systems to join us. In this role, you’ll create intuitive, user-focused interfaces for software, allowing individuals with communication challenges to express themselves using innovative eye-tracking technology.
What You’ll Do:
Champion System Thinking: Craft scalable, reusable solutions that seamlessly align across platforms and products.  

  

Develop and Document Design Standards: Establish design principles, components, interaction patterns, and design tokens rooted in accessibility guidelines to promote consistency across our software suite.  

  

Ensure Seamless Collaboration: Prepare comprehensive design documentation for smooth handovers to our development teams.  

  

Collaborate Cross-Functionally: Work closely with product managers, developers, speech therapists, and fellow designers to create user-centric solutions that are aligned with our goals.
We have a hybrid model so you will be able to have the mix of working both from our office at Löjtnantsgatan 25 and from the comfort of your own home.  

What We’re Looking For:* Proven UX Experience: A solid background in UX design with a portfolio that showcases your ability to deliver impactful projects. (If you don’t have a portfolio, tell us why – we’re interested in your story!)
* Design Systems Expertise: Demonstrated experience in building or maintaining a design system for multi-component, multi-platform products.
* Proficiency with Design Tools: High-level skills in Figma, Adobe XD, Sketch, or similar software (We are using Figma!)
* Excellent Communication: Strong interpersonal skills to collaborate effectively within multidisciplinary teams.

  

Bonus Points For:* Accessibility Expertise: A strong understanding of accessibility standards (e.g., WCAG) and experience designing for users with diverse physical or cognitive abilities.


Next step!  

Connect with Mikaela Nilsson at mikaela.nilsson@tobiidynavox.com for any questions. Submit your resume or LinkedIn profile through our website. Please submit all application materials in English. We’re excited to learn more about you and your passion for accessible design!  

Where we stand:  

We believe diversity not only enriches our workplace culture, but also gives us a strategic advantage. Working with people from a variety of backgrounds and perspectives helps us all become better communicators, better problem solvers, and better human beings. Our differences make us stronger.  

Tobii Dynavox values equality of opportunity, human dignity, and racial/ethnic and cultural diversity. Tobii Dynavox does not discriminate against individuals on the basis of race, color, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, religion, disability, age, veteran status, ancestry, or national or ethnic origin.
Equal Opportunity Employer/AA Women/Minorities/Veterans/Disabled
company_description: Tobii Dynavox’s mission is to empower people with disabilities to do what they once did, or never thought possible.

title: UX Researcher
description:
Who we are:  

  

At Tobii Dynavox, we empower people with disabilities to do what they once did or never thought possible. We call this mission Power to Be You. Our assistive communication technology helps our customers express themselves, connect with the world, and pursue independence, whether through everyday activities like ordering food or extraordinary feats like running a company. Working at Tobii Dynavox, you’ll become part of a team that spans the globe, with offices in the US, Sweden, France, the UK, China, and beyond.  

  

To learn more about what we make possible, meet some of our customers or take a look at some of our products.  

  

What you’ll do:
We make touch and eye tracking based assistive technology for people with communication and mobility challenges. The success of our products has life-changing impact on our customers. Our Research & Development Team develops the hardware, software, and other technology that makes that impact possible.
Are you passionate about diving deep into user needs and transforming research into impactful design? We’re looking for a dedicated UX Researcher to join our team. In this role, you will explore the minds of our users through interviews, usability testing, surveys, and more. Your insights will be the cornerstone of our product design and strategy, ensuring we create meaningful experiences that help people with communication challenges express themselves using cutting-edge eye-tracking technology.  

What you’ll do in the role:* Conduct a variety of qualitative and quantitative research methods, including interviews, usability tests, surveys, data analytics, and card sorting, to understand the needs and challenges of AAC users, caregivers, educators, and clinicians.
* Build and manage a robust research repository, leveraging tools like Dovetail or Airtable, to organize and share insights across teams.
* Evaluate product impact through longitudinal studies and post-launch feedback to measure the effectiveness of AAC tools and solutions.
* Develop detailed user personas, journey maps, and scenarios to represent the diverse needs and experiences of our user base.
* Design and facilitate usability tests for new and existing product features, iterating based on user feedback.
* Synthesize research data into clear, actionable reports and presentations, effectively communicating findings to stakeholders.
* Collaborate closely with product managers, designers, and clinical researchers to turn research insights into impactful product and design solutions.


We have a hybrid model so you'll be able to have the mix of working both from our office at Löjtnantsgatan 25 and the comfort of your own home.
What We’re Looking For:* A degree in Human-Computer Interaction (HCI), Psychology, Social Sciences, or a related field.
* Proven experience in user research, preferably within the healthcare or assistive technology sectors.
* Strong background in using research repositories (e.g., Dovetail, Airtable) for effective organization and dissemination of insights.
* Proficiency with research tools such as User Interviews, Maze, Optimal Workshop, Hotjar, and survey platforms.
* Comprehensive knowledge of UX principles and design methodologies like Double Diamond and Design Thinking.
* Exceptional analytical, organizational, and communication skills.

  

Next step:
Connect with Mikaela Nilsson at mikaela.nilsson@tobiidynavox.com for any questions. Submit your resume or LinkedIn profile through our website. Please submit all application materials in English. We’re excited to learn more about you and your passion for accessible design!  

Where we stand:  

We believe diversity not only enriches our workplace culture, but also gives us a strategic advantage. Working with people from a variety of backgrounds and perspectives helps us all become better communicators, better problem solvers, and better human beings. Our differences make us stronger.  

Tobii Dynavox values equality of opportunity, human dignity, and racial/ethnic and cultural diversity. Tobii Dynavox does not discriminate against individuals on the basis of race, color, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, religion, disability, age, veteran status, ancestry, or national or ethnic origin.
Equal Opportunity Employer/AA Women/Minorities/Veterans/Disabled
company_description: Tobii Dynavox’s mission is to empower people with disabilities to do what they once did, or never thought possible.

title: Applikationsarkitekt
description:
Om tjänsten


Ansök senast: **18 december 2024**Kommun: **Lund**Omfattning: **Heltid**Antal sökande: 2
Anställningsform: **Tillsvidareanställning**Tillträde: **Tillträde sker enligt överenskommelse.**Referensnummer: C217335
  
Gör skillnad. Varje dag.
  

  

Har du en passion för applikationsarkitektur, API:er och agila metoder samt vill utvecklas tillsammans med glada och engagerade kollegor? Letar du efter ett arbete där du får möjlighet att skapa nytt och samtidigt bidra i ett samhällsviktigt uppdrag? Då kanske du är vår nästa applikationsarkitekt!  

  

Som applikationsarkitekt kommer du att tillhöra enheten för mjukvaruutveckling och automation. Enhetens uppdrag är att möta digitala behov där det inte finns färdiga lösningar att köpa på marknaden. Vi erbjuder högkvalitativ design och utveckling som tillför värde och nytta för medarbetare, patienter och invånare i Region Skåne. Enheten växer och det finns stora möjligheter att få vara med och påverka hur vi arbetar och organiserar oss.  

  

Missa inte denna möjlighet att vara en del av Region Skånes digitala transformation!


Arbetsuppgifter


Som applikationsarkitekt arbetar du med applikationer och plattformar tillsammans med våra mjukvaruutvecklingsteam som består av systemutvecklare, team coacher, produktägare, testare, UX-specialister. Du samverkar även med andra arkitekter i Region Skånes arkitekturråd under ledning av chefsarkitekten.
  

  

Ditt uppdrag som applikationsarkitekt innefattar bland annat att:
  

* stödja mjukvaruutvecklingsteam i arkitektur och design av applikationer och mjukvarukomponenter
* ta fram krav och beslutsunderlag för applikationer som omfattar såväl verksamhets- som teknikperspektiv
* genomföra utvärderingar av applikationer, plattformar och komponenter
* bidra till att utveckla Region Skånes processer för mjukvaruutveckling
* designa och planera utvecklingen av mjukvarulösningar
* utforma riktlinjer för användning och publicering av öppen källkod.

  

Därtill bedriver du omvärldsbevakning inom applikationsarkitektur och applikationsutveckling, exempelvis low code-applikationer och containeriserade applikationer. Du arbetar också med kravutveckling tillsammans med intressenter och andra arkitekter, samt stödjer intressenter i att förstå och tillämpa kraven.
  

  

Vi utgår från våra lokaler på Medicon Village i Lund, även om distansarbete har blivit en naturlig del av vår vardag.
Kvalifikationer


Vi söker dig med en stark kombination av specialistkompetens och personliga egenskaper som gör dig till en lysande applikationsarkitekt. För att vara aktuell för tjänsten krävs därför att du har:  

* gedigen och bred kompetens inom applikationsarkitektur och design av mjukvarulösningar
* gedigen teknisk kompetens och erfarenhet av systemutveckling
* god kompetens inom säkerhetsåtgärder för att skydda mjukvarulösningar
* god förmåga att förstå verksamhetens behov, förutsättningar och viktigaste frågor
* god pedagogisk förmåga att beskriva och presentera lösningsarkitektur, både muntligt och skriftligt
* en relevant eftergymnasial utbildning, alternativt annan utbildning eller erfarenhet som vi bedömer likvärdig
* goda kunskaper i svenska och engelska, såväl i tal som skrift.


  

Vi ser det som meriterande om du därutöver har erfarenhet av:
  

* DevOps, Infrastructure as Code och CI/CD
* containerisering
* plattformar för API hantering, mikrotjänster och low-code utveckling
* kvalitetssäkring och test av mjukvara
* frontendramverk
* utveckla och drifta applikationer i molnmiljö
* arbete inom hälso- och sjukvårdsverksamhet.

  

Därutöver är det fördelaktigt om du har någon relevant certifiering inom arkitektur, Azure och/eller applikationsutveckling.
  

  

Som person är du nyfiken och vill ständigt utvecklas. Ditt arbetssätt präglas av ett tydligt fokus på leverans och förmåga att driva samt hantera flera aktiviteter parallellt. I arbetet är du självgående och i ditt angreppssätt utgår du från befintliga förutsättningar. Du har en mycket god samarbetsförmåga och lyhördhet som gör att du har lätt för att förstå kundens verksamhet och behov. Därtill är du tydlig i din kommunikation och har förmåga att förklara för personer som är mer eller mindre insatta i arkitektur. I ditt arbete har du förmåga att växla mellan detaljnivå och ett större strategiskt perspektiv.
  

  

I den här rekryteringen arbetar vi med löpande urval så vänta inte med att skicka in din ansökan! Vi ser fram emot att lära känna dig.
Övrigt


Region Skåne finns till för att alla som bor i Skåne ska må bra och känna framtidstro. Genom gränslösa samarbeten och omtanke skapas de bästa förutsättningar för ett hälsosamt liv inom näringsliv, kollektivtrafik, kultur och hälso- och sjukvård i Skåne. Tillsammans gör vi livet mera möjligt.
  

  

Förvaltningen Digitalisering IT och MT ger stöd och service till den skånska hälso- och sjukvården. Förvaltningens uppdrag är att införa en modern och sammanhållen digital vårdmiljö parallellt med drift och effektiv konsolidering av dagens befintliga IT-miljö. I uppdraget ingår förvaltning och support av befintliga och kommande system. Medicinsk teknik (MT) arbetar även med service, underhåll, inköp och egentillverkning av medicinteknisk utrustning.  

  

Förvaltningen ansvarar också för de grundläggande vårdinformationssystemen och driver utvecklingen av framtidens vårdinformation. Vi är cirka 350 medarbetare i förvaltningen och finns vid samtliga sjukhusområden i Skåne med huvudsäte i Lund.
  

  

På https://www.skane.se/ledigajobb kan du se i vilket skede Region Skånes rekryteringar befinner sig och hur många som har sökt tjänsterna.
  

  

Till bemannings- och rekryteringsföretag och till dig som är försäljare: Vi undanber oss vänligen men bestämt direktkontakt med bemannings- och rekryteringsföretag samt försäljare av ytterligare jobbannonser

  




Kontaktperson

title: AI Engineer till Kundo
description:
Om företaget
  
Kundo är ett innovativt SaaS-bolag med målet att erbjuda det mest användarvänliga kundservicesystemet på marknaden. Genom att utveckla moderna digitala lösningar för kundservice strävar vi efter att bli Nordens främsta leverantör inom detta område. Vi befinner oss i en bransch som snabbt förändras och där AI-teknologier öppnar dörren för effektivisering och nytänkande. I takt med vår tillväxtresa bygger vi en plattform som sätter AI i centrum för kundservice, och vi söker nu talangfulla medarbetare som vill vara med och forma framtiden för kundservice.
  
  

Om tjänstenSom AI Engineer på Kundo kommer du att spela en avgörande roll i vårt tvärfunktionella team, där du utvecklar och implementerar AI-drivna funktioner som förvandlar användarupplevelsen och ökar produktens effektivitet. Rollen erbjuder en unik möjlighet att arbeta med avancerad AI-teknik, där du integrerar AI som en självklar del i vår produkt och bidrar till hela bolagets produktstrategi. Här blir du en viktig länk mellan kundbehov och AI-lösningar, vilket innebär att du driver processen från behovsidentifiering till optimering och mätning av effekt.
  
Som AI Engineer kommer du att arbeta nära UX-designers, produktchefer och utvecklingsteam för att säkerställa att våra AI-lösningar inte bara möter våra kunders förväntningar utan även ligger i linje med Kundos långsiktiga mål.
  
  

**Dina huvudsakliga arbetsuppgifter:**  

Designa, utveckla och underhålla AI-baserade system med fokus på moderna teknologier som stora språkmodeller (LLM), Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG), AI-agenter och AI-pipelines.
  
Arbeta i nära samarbete med tvärfunktionella team för att se till att AI-lösningarna är anpassade till kundernas behov och affärsmål.
  
Vara en central aktör i utvecklingen av Kundos långsiktiga AI-strategi och bidra till bolagets tekniska utveckling inom AI.
  
Kvalifikationer och egenskaper
  
Vi söker dig som har en djup teknisk förståelse och ett brinnande intresse för AI-innovation. Du är skicklig på att skapa lösningar som kombinerar både teknisk precision och kundfokus.
  
  

**För att trivas och lyckas i rollen ser vi att du har:**  

Minst 5 års erfarenhet av mjukvaruutveckling
  
Gedigen erfarenhet av Python
  
Minst 2 års erfarenhet av att arbeta med moderna AI-tekniker, såsom stora språkmodeller, AI-pipelines och AI-agenter
  
Erfarenhet av att designa och implementera AI-lösningar
  
Erfarenhet inom data engineering är meriterande
  
  

Övrig informationVi tillämpar löpande urval i denna process vilket innebär att tjänsten kan tillsättas innan sista ansökningsdag. Vi rekommenderar dig därför att ansöka så snart som möjligt!
  
Har du frågor eller funderingar kring Asta Agencys rekryteringsprocess, tveka inte att höra av dig till jimmy@astaagency.se.

title: UX Designer med visuell spets
description:
**Varför denna roll passar dig:**


Du vill arbeta i ett team där samarbete, kreativitet och utveckling står i fokus. Du brinner för att skapa digitala, användarcentrerade, produkter som inte bara ser bra ut, utan också löser verkliga problem. Hos oss på Knightec och vårt affärsområde Daresay kommer du att spela en avgörande roll i att förvandla idéer till digitala upplevelser. Med din starka visuella designförmåga och ditt engagemang för användarupplevelse, kommer du att hjälpa oss att skapa meningsfulla lösningar för både lokala och globala kunder.


Du är en designer som vill göra skillnad genom att kombinera estetik och funktionalitet i våra projekt. Just nu jobbar vi mycket med AI-lösningar, digital hållbarhet, myndigheter, med-tech, automotive och fin-tech. Kanske har du erfarenhet från dessa områden, eller en nyfikenhet att lära dig mer.

**Arbetsuppgifter:**

* Designa och utveckla användarcentrerade digitala produkter med fokus på visuell kvalitet och användarupplevelse.
* Ansvara för den visuella leveransen i våra projekt, och säkerställa att designen är i linje med kundens varumärke och användarnas behov.
* Motivera och kommunicera lösningar och prioriteringar.
* Samarbeta och samskapa med våra kunder och team för att skapa innovativa och användarvänliga lösningar.
* Skapa och använda designkomponenter, inklusive ikonografi, färger, typsnitt, och animationer, för att förstärka användarupplevelsen.
* Prototypa, användartesta och iterera designlösningar baserat på användarinsikter och feedback.
* Skapa och implementera designsystem.

Leda och delta i workshops för co-creation.  
* 

**Kvalifikationer:**

* Relevant utbildning inom design.
* Minst 3 års erfarenhet av liknande roller, som UX Designer eller Produktdesigner, med en inriktning på visuell design. Bonus med erfarenhet från både konsultbolag och produktbolag.
* Erfarenhet av att arbeta med kundcentrerade och iterativa designprojekt.
* Erfarenhet av att arbeta med designsystem och att fatta beslut om den visuella inriktningen av projekt.
* Erfarenhet av, och god förståelse för, digital tillgänglighet.
* Förmåga att arbeta i tvärfunktionella team och att samarbeta effektivt med både kollegor och kunder.
* God kommunikationsförmåga - flytande i svenska och engelska, både i tal och skrift.
* Meriterande med erfarenhet av AI-lösningar, digital hållbarhet, myndigheter, med-tech, automotive eller fin-tech.

  



**Vad vi erbjuder:**


På Knightec och vårt affärsområde Daresay får du möjlighet att arbeta i en kreativ och stöttande miljö där din professionella utveckling står i centrum. Vi värdesätter mångfald och inkludering, och vår arbetsplats är en dynamisk miljö där många nationaliteter bidrar med sina unika perspektiv. Vi arbetar i en hybrid arbetsmodell som främjar balans mellan arbete och privatliv, samt erbjuder konkurrenskraftiga förmåner för din trygghet och utveckling. Detta inkluderar individuell kompetensutvecklingsbudget, friskvårdsbidrag, tjänstepension m.m.

  

Vi brinner för digital transformation och strävar efter att ta oss an projekt med en positiv inverkan på samhället och att hjälpa företag bli mer cirkulära. Vi tror på samarbete och samskapande med våra kunder och deras användare. På det sättet skapar vi kundupplevelser som hjälper våra kunder att uppnå sina strategiska mål.

 **Ansökningsprocessen:**


Vi ser fram emot att få din ansökan tillsammans med CV, portfolio och personligt brev. Ansökningarna behandlas löpande och tjänsten är öppen tillsvidare. Om du har några frågor, tveka inte att kontakta oss.

title: UX Designer
description:
**Work with us towards a greener future**
 Climate change is a reality. As a mobility provider, we recognise our impact on the environment and are determined to play our part in contributing to sustainable solutions. And it’s so exciting – we’re well on our way on our journey towards full electrification. If you share our commitment for creating a positive environmental impact, then join us in our mission to advance towards a greener future.
   

  

 What you'll do?
   

  

 As a UX Designer in the Car UX team, you will work on defining and building a safe and effortless experience for our users, to make the car their own through different driving functionalities and controls. Your responsibilities will include identifying problems to be solved, mapping out desirable and feasible solutions for our users through e.g. utilizing user journeys and prototyping that balance design aesthetics with intuitive functionality.
   

  

 You will collaborate with other designers and ensure a seamless customer experience across Volvo’s digital landscape. And as part of a product team, you will communicate designs, ideas, and rationale with your team using data and customer insights.
   

  

 As a designer you advocate for the user, you will develop a deep understanding of our customer needs and pain-points, serving as an expert for your product team and develop ideas for new and enhanced features.
   

  

 Your focus will be in developing technically informed and people focused hypotheses and designs on how to humanize the way to present driver centric information to our users. Your bread and butter will be to understand and untangle complex technical functionalities and requirements and structure them in a clear and glanceable way to our users. You have strong design skills and a track record that demonstrates how you create and build on top of existing design systems.
   

  

 Who you are?
   

  

* You’ve been designing for 3+ years for a consumer-focused tech company, so you understand what it takes to create elegant, consumer-oriented experiences.
* You know that appropriate design solutions come not from a brief or a focus group but rather from the deep understanding of our users, their context and the challenges created by technology within that context.
* You are a versatile designer who uses a full range of skills—product design, interaction design, and visual design or prototyping — to ensure you deliver magical experiences to the customer.
* You are a strong collaborator, who can work with not only design partners, but many other stakeholders from engineering to marketing.
* You’re a strong communicator who can inspire teams towards action and empathy for the user.
* You have a people-focused design mentality. Constantly looking to hone your design instinct through user feedback. Whether that’s hands-on user research or a quantitative A/B test.


 What’s in it for you?
   

  

 Volvo Cars is on an ambitious journey to redefine what it means to own a vehicle during one of most innovative times in the transport industry. Volvo Cars is looking to redefine all aspects of the car eco-system including ownership, autonomous driving, vehicle electrification, sustainability and online shopping. User Experience as a discipline is a key part of Volvo Cars' strategy and a newly formed UX organization will help gather insights about our user's and redefine and elevate the users experience of Volvo's products and Services.
   

  

 We are seeking for a UX Designer to expand our Driving Experience team, A team whose goal is to understand and evaluate all legal, technical, local and ambient information streams and vehicle specific functionality to create the best strategy and execution for a safe and naturalistic display and control of information.
   

  

 Ready to Take the Next Step?
   

  

 Please submit your application through our career page. Due to GDPR regulations, we’re unable to store or consider applications from other platforms. Make sure to submit your application in English.
   

  

 If you have any questions about the recruitment process, you are welcome to reach out to Amrita Namboothiri at amrita.namboothiri@volvocars.com.
   

  

 Volvo Cars – driving change together
   

  

 Volvo Cars’ success is the result of a collaborative, diverse and inclusive working environment. Today, we’re one of the most well-known and respected car brands, with around 43,000 employees across the globe. At Volvo Cars, your career is designed around your skills and aspirations, so you can reach your fullest potential.
   

  

 And it’s so exciting – we’re well on our way on our journey towards full electrification. We have five fully electric cars already on the market, and five more on the way. Our fully-electric and plug-in hybrid cars combined make up almost 50 per cent of our sales. So come and join us in shaping the future of mobility. There’s never been a more rewarding time to play your part in our inspiring and creative teams!

title: UX Designer
description:
**Who we are:**
 At Tobii Dynavox, we empower people with disabilities to do what they once did or never thought possible. We call this mission Power to Be You. Our assistive communication technology helps our customers express themselves, connect with the world, and pursue independence, whether through everyday activities like ordering food or extraordinary feats like running a company. Working at Tobii Dynavox, you’ll become part of a team that spans the globe, with offices in the US, Sweden, France, the UK, China, and beyond.
   

  

 To learn more about what we make possible, meet some of our customers or take a look at some of our products.
   

  

**What you’ll do:**
 We make touch and eye tracking based assistive technology for people with communication and mobility challenges. The success of our products has life-changing impact on our customers. Our Research & Development Team develops the hardware, software, and other technology that makes that impact possible.
   

  

 We’re on the lookout for a UX Designer with a strong passion for accessibility and design systems to join us. In this role, you’ll create intuitive, user-focused interfaces for software, allowing individuals with communication challenges to express themselves using innovative eye-tracking technology.
   

  

**What You’ll Do:**
**Champion System Thinking:** 
 Craft scalable, reusable solutions that seamlessly align across platforms and products.
   

  

**Develop and Document Design Standards:** 
 Establish design principles, components, interaction patterns, and design tokens rooted in accessibility guidelines to promote consistency across our software suite.
   

  

**Ensure Seamless Collaboration:** 
 Prepare comprehensive design documentation for smooth handovers to our development teams.
   

  

**Collaborate Cross-Functionally:** 
 Work closely with product managers, developers, speech therapists, and fellow designers to create user-centric solutions that are aligned with our goals.
   

  

 We have a hybrid model so you will be able to have the mix of working both from our office at Löjtnantsgatan 25 and from the comfort of your own home.
   

  

**What We’re Looking For:**
* Proven UX Experience: A solid background in UX design with a portfolio that showcases your ability to deliver impactful projects. (If you don’t have a portfolio, tell us why – we’re interested in your story!)
* Design Systems Expertise: Demonstrated experience in building or maintaining a design system for multi-component, multi-platform products.
* Proficiency with Design Tools: High-level skills in Figma, Adobe XD, Sketch, or similar software (We are using Figma!)
* Excellent Communication: Strong interpersonal skills to collaborate effectively within multidisciplinary teams.


**Bonus Points For:**
* Accessibility Expertise: A strong understanding of accessibility standards (e.g., WCAG) and experience designing for users with diverse physical or cognitive abilities.


**Next step!**
 Connect with Mikaela Nilsson at mikaela.nilsson@tobiidynavox.com for any questions. Submit your resume or LinkedIn profile through our website. Please submit all application materials in English. We’re excited to learn more about you and your passion for accessible design!
   

  

**Where we stand:**
 We believe diversity not only enriches our workplace culture, but also gives us a strategic advantage. Working with people from a variety of backgrounds and perspectives helps us all become better communicators, better problem solvers, and better human beings. Our differences make us stronger.
   

  

 Tobii Dynavox values equality of opportunity, human dignity, and racial/ethnic and cultural diversity. Tobii Dynavox does not discriminate against individuals on the basis of race, color, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, religion, disability, age, veteran status, ancestry, or national or ethnic origin.

title: UI/UX Manager
job_function: Design, Information Technology, and Product Management
company_industry: Gambling Facilities and Casinos and Software Development
description:
At Derivco, we believe that our people are not just employees – they are the heart and soul of our business. It's their skills, expertise, and passion that define who we are and drive us towards excellence every day.
 



 We empower our people to think creatively, push boundaries, and take ownership of their work. We don't just want employees; we want innovators and difference-makers who are ready to make an impact.
 



  





 Culture is at the core of everything we do. We create an environment where our people can thrive, grow, and unleash their full potential. We provide the right tools, support, and opportunities for personal and professional development.
 



  





 We are currently looking for an UI/UX Manager to join our team!
 



  





**Role Overview:** 
 Lead and manage a team of skilled designers, encouraging collaboration and innovation. Your unrivalled design vision and understanding of user needs will be instrumental in creating best in breed digital products that captivate audiences. With a strong interest in social media and a deep understanding of the digital landscape, you will stay ahead of trends and ensure our products fit ours users needs.
 



  





**Key responsibilities** 



* User Interface Design: Create visually appealing and intuitive user interfaces for social media-based features that can be seamlessly integrated into various online digital products.
* User Experience Design: Develop user-centered design solutions that enhance user engagement, satisfaction, and retention within the community-building context.
* Wireframes and Prototypes: Produce wireframes and interactive prototypes to communicate design concepts, gather feedback, and iterate on designs.
* Information Architecture: Define the structure and organisation of content within the social media features to ensure easy navigation and findability.
* Interaction Design: Design intuitive and engaging interactions, including user flows, micro-interactions, and animations, to enhance the user experience.
* Visual Design: Create visually consistent and on-brand designs that align with the iGaming company's identity and appeal to the target audience.
* Usability Testing: Conduct usability testing sessions to gather user feedback, identify pain points, and iterate on designs for continuous improvement.
* Design Documentation: Prepare design specifications, style guides, and design system documentation to ensure consistency and facilitate collaboration with developers.
* Collaboration and Communication: Work closely with cross-functional teams, including developers, product managers, and stakeholders, to align on design goals and ensure successful implementation.
* Community Engagement Features: Design and implement features that encourage community engagement, user-generated content, social interactions, and gamification elements.
* Accessibility: Ensure that the social media features are accessible to all users, adhering to accessibility guidelines and best practices.
* Data Analysis and Optimisation: Analyse user data and metrics to identify opportunities for improvement, optimise user experiences, and drive community growth.
* Product Strategy: Close collaboration with product team to ensure that each product is crafted is such way that its successful for the business and loved by users.



  





**Key Qualifications and Experience** 



* 8 – 10 years of experience with 8 years of experience in Design or related fields and at least 3 years of experience in a Leadership role.
* User Interface Design: Strong skills in creating visually appealing and intuitive user interfaces that align with the brand and target audience.
* User Experience Design: Proficiency in user research, information architecture, interaction design, and usability testing to create seamless and engaging user experiences.
* Prototyping and Wireframing: Experience in using tools like Figma, Sketch or other similar design tools to create interactive prototypes and wireframes for user testing and stakeholder feedback.
* Mobile and Responsive Design: Understanding the unique challenges of designing for mobile devices and creating responsive layouts that adapt to different screen sizes.
* Front-end Development: Strong skills in HTML, CSS, and JavaScript to effectively collaborate with developers and ensure the technical feasibility of design concepts.
* Design Systems: Experience in creating and maintaining design systems, to ensure consistency and efficiency across different projects and teams.
* Data Visualisation: Knowledge of data visualisation techniques and tools to present complex information in a clear and visually appealing manner.
* Accessibility: Understanding of accessibility guidelines (W3C WCAG 2.0+) and best practices to ensure that designs are inclusive and accessible to all users.








**Knowledge & Experience** 



* iGaming Industry: Familiarity with the iGaming industry, including an understanding of social media-based features and community-building strategies within this context.
* Social Media Integration: Knowledge of integrating social media features into digital products, including authentication, sharing, and engagement functionalities.
* Community Building: Experience in designing features and interfaces that foster community engagement, user-generated content, and social interactions.
* Gamification: Understanding of gamification principles and techniques to enhance user engagement and retention within the iGaming context.
* Analytics and Metrics: Ability to analyze user data and metrics to inform design decisions and optimize user experiences.
* Agile Methodology: Experience working in an Agile development environment, collaborating closely with cross-functional teams and iterating designs based on feedback.



  





 Derivco is an equal opportunities employer.
 



 We value people as individuals with diverse opinions, cultures, lifestyles and circumstances and we are committed to equality of opportunity and to providing a productive working environment free from unfair and unlawful discrimination

title: UX Researcher
description:
**Who we are:**
 At Tobii Dynavox, we empower people with disabilities to do what they once did or never thought possible. We call this mission Power to Be You. Our assistive communication technology helps our customers express themselves, connect with the world, and pursue independence, whether through everyday activities like ordering food or extraordinary feats like running a company. Working at Tobii Dynavox, you’ll become part of a team that spans the globe, with offices in the US, Sweden, France, the UK, China, and beyond.
   

  

 To learn more about what we make possible, meet some of our customers or take a look at some of our products.
   

  

**What you’ll do:**
 We make touch and eye tracking based assistive technology for people with communication and mobility challenges. The success of our products has life-changing impact on our customers. Our Research & Development Team develops the hardware, software, and other technology that makes that impact possible.
   

  

 Are you passionate about diving deep into user needs and transforming research into impactful design? We’re looking for a dedicated UX Researcher to join our team. In this role, you will explore the minds of our users through interviews, usability testing, surveys, and more. Your insights will be the cornerstone of our product design and strategy, ensuring we create meaningful experiences that help people with communication challenges express themselves using cutting-edge eye-tracking technology.
   

  

**What you’ll do in the role:**
* Conduct a variety of qualitative and quantitative research methods, including interviews, usability tests, surveys, data analytics, and card sorting, to understand the needs and challenges of AAC users, caregivers, educators, and clinicians.
* Build and manage a robust research repository, leveraging tools like Dovetail or Airtable, to organize and share insights across teams.
* Evaluate product impact through longitudinal studies and post-launch feedback to measure the effectiveness of AAC tools and solutions.
* Develop detailed user personas, journey maps, and scenarios to represent the diverse needs and experiences of our user base.
* Design and facilitate usability tests for new and existing product features, iterating based on user feedback.
* Synthesize research data into clear, actionable reports and presentations, effectively communicating findings to stakeholders.
* Collaborate closely with product managers, designers, and clinical researchers to turn research insights into impactful product and design solutions.


 We have a hybrid model so you'll be able to have the mix of working both from our office at Löjtnantsgatan 25 and the comfort of your own home.
   

  

**What We’re Looking For:**
* A degree in Human-Computer Interaction (HCI), Psychology, Social Sciences, or a related field.
* Proven experience in user research, preferably within the healthcare or assistive technology sectors.
* Strong background in using research repositories (e.g., Dovetail, Airtable) for effective organization and dissemination of insights.
* Proficiency with research tools such as User Interviews, Maze, Optimal Workshop, Hotjar, and survey platforms.
* Comprehensive knowledge of UX principles and design methodologies like Double Diamond and Design Thinking.
* Exceptional analytical, organizational, and communication skills.


**Next step:**
 Connect with Mikaela Nilsson at mikaela.nilsson@tobiidynavox.com for any questions. Submit your resume or LinkedIn profile through our website. Please submit all application materials in English. We’re excited to learn more about you and your passion for accessible design!
   

  

**Where we stand:**
 We believe diversity not only enriches our workplace culture, but also gives us a strategic advantage. Working with people from a variety of backgrounds and perspectives helps us all become better communicators, better problem solvers, and better human beings. Our differences make us stronger.
   

  

 Tobii Dynavox values equality of opportunity, human dignity, and racial/ethnic and cultural diversity. Tobii Dynavox does not discriminate against individuals on the basis of race, color, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, religion, disability, age, veteran status, ancestry, or national or ethnic origin.
   

  

 Equal Opportunity Employer/AA Women/Minorities/Veterans/Disabled

title: Experienced User Researcher
description:
Paradox’s User Research team does user experience research for all our products, both developed in-house and published by Paradox. As a User Researcher, you will be responsible for conducting a variety of research activities and supporting the team in their activities. Our current UR team consists of six researchers.
   

  

 We expect you to be able to identify the root question(s) and provide relevant insights that will support the decision-making of our game developers. You will collaborate with UX designers, game designers, data analysts and studio leaders to champion UX research that connects with our player base and addresses the most crucial design challenges we may face. Your work will be critical in helping us understand the needs and behaviours of our users.
   

  

 You will be expected to take an active role in developing our methodology, testing environment, and help us build one of the best User Research teams in the industry.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
* Coordinate with the team and our stakeholders to iteratively improve our processes for collecting, analyzing and presenting research data
* Conduct user research on a variety of Paradox games and products
* Create research plans together with the development teams
* Choose the methods that will help game teams the most - user studies, focus groups, surveys, user review analyses, etc.
* Communicate actionable insights to game teams and other stakeholders at Paradox Interactive


**Requirements**
* At least 4 years of experience in user research, and 2 years as a mid-level (or higher) games user researcher
* Experience with a wide range of qualitative research methodologies such as usability studies, interviews etc.
* Experience with game development or other interactive media fields
* Excellent written and spoken communication skills (English)
* Comfortable coordinating clients, other researchers, and participants simultaneously under tight timelines when conducting research
* Strong personal interest in the gaming industry and market trends


 On a personal level you’re passionate about helping others succeed. You find communication with people of different professions (game design, production, marketing) inspiring and you have a strong sense of self-leadership. You enjoy the balancing act between conducting sound research and delivering objective, actionable results with tight time-frames, and don’t mind challenging established views.
   

  

**Practical information**
 Scope: Full time and permanent
   

  

 Reports to: User Research Manager
   

  

 Location: This position is based in Stockholm, Sweden.
   

  

 We will only recruit locally for this role
   

  

*If you think that this description matches your background, we highly encourage you to apply as soon as possible as we will interview candidates continuously for this position. In your application, please show us why your previous experiences and skills would work for this role and why you are interested in working at Paradox. If you don't match all the requirements, please demonstrate how your passion, attitude and interest in Paradox might compensate for this.*
 Today, Paradox consists of both publishing and internal game development. We have a broad portfolio of games and own the most important brands, including Stellaris, Europa Universalis, Hearts of Iron, Crusader Kings, Cities: Skylines, Prison Architect, Victoria, Age of Wonders and the World of Darkness catalog of brands.
   

  

 Since 2004, the company has published its games all over the world, initially through physical distribution but primarily in digital channels after 2006. Paradox games are developed primarily for PC and console platforms, but the company also releases games on mobile. The largest markets today include the US, UK, China, Germany, France and Scandinavia. In total, Paradox games have over five million players each month.

title: Senior UX Researcher & Strategist
description:
**Crafting Data-Informed Experiences That Empower Users**
 Are you a passionate advocate for users? Do you believe that great design, driven by insightful research, has the power to transform the way people interact with digital products? Do you value the power of true teamwork? If so, we have an exciting opportunity for you to join Azets as a Senior UX Researcher & Strategist.
   

  

**About Azets**
 Azets is not just a place to work; it is a company where you can invest your ingenuity and passion into directly improving our clients’ business landscapes. As a leader in accounting, tax, payroll, and business advisory services across the Nordics, UK, and Ireland, we empower over 100,000 clients through 190+ offices. Our purpose—improving the lives of our colleagues, our clients, and our communities—drives our dedication to delivering high-quality, personal services both digitally and in-person. Join us in our mission to support clients ranging from startups to blue-chip companies, helping them focus on what they do best while we handle the complexities of their accounting, tax, payroll, and other financial operations.
   

  

**About Azets Software**
 As a crucial part of Azets Group, our 40-person Azets Software team pioneers software solutions, serving over 170,000 users from 30,000+ clients. With teams distributed across 8 countries, we thrive in a truly global and vibrant work environment.
   

  

**Our Design and Research Journey**
 Enterprise software has historically lagged behind consumer applications in creating well-designed user experiences. Azets Software is committed to creating experiences that are on par with consumer apps in usability, functionality, and enabling users to achieve their goals. We've made significant strides towards this mission, including establishing our design system, forming cross-functional teams, and expanding our design organization under the leadership of James, our Head of Design.
   

  

 As we continue to grow, we recognize the need for research-driven insights to further inform and elevate our design processes. We have ambitions to strengthen our capacity with disciplines such as service design, design ops, and most crucially—user research.
   

  

 Our team, which currently consists of three user experience designers and three user interface designers focused on the design system, is dedicated to building trusting relationships, empathy, and supporting each other daily to help us be our best selves. Now, we are looking to add a research expert who can steer our design decisions with evidence-backed insights and foster a culture of continuous learning.
   

  

**Your New Challenge...**
 As our Senior UX Researcher & Strategist, you will be at the forefront of our efforts to make data-driven decisions that significantly enhance our products' user experience. You will lead the charge of developing and executing research strategies that inform every level of our design and product development processes.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities In Your First Year**
 Strategic Research Leadership
   

  

* Develop and implement a comprehensive research strategy that aligns with our business goals and drives user-centered innovation.
* Advocate for the integration of research into all stages of product development, ensuring that every decision is informed by data and user insights.


 Data and Tools Optimization
   

  

* Assess and optimize the use of existing data sources and research tools,
* Identify, justify, and integrate new data sources and tools, ensuring that each choice is cost-effective and strategically enhances our understanding of user behavior and needs.


 User Engagement and Insight Generation
   

  

* Innovate methods to access and engage users, even in challenging contexts, to gather meaningful and unbiased insights.
* Collaborate with internal teams and business units to facilitate research, ensuring that the voice of the user is always represented in our decision-making processes.


**And beyond your first year...**
 Execution and Mentorship
   

  

* Lead large-scale research initiatives that provide deep insights into user needs and behaviors, directly influencing our product strategy.
* Establish research operations across the organisation. Build scalable processes, select the right tools, and embed research practices that ensure consistent, high-quality insights are integrated into every stage of our product development lifecycle.
* Mentor our design team and others


 Research Roadmap and Continuous Improvement
   

  

* Create and maintain a research roadmap that drives continuous improvement in how we gather and utilize data.
* Work closely with data analysts to deliver actionable insights that inform and enhance product management and design.


**Ideal Candidate**
**Experience**
* Proven track record in senior research roles, particularly within complex organizations.
* Experience in setting up and scaling research strategies and operations.
* Deep expertise in both qualitative and quantitative research methods.


**Skills**
* Strategic thinking with the ability to translate research insights into impactful product and design decisions.
* Effective communication skills with the ability to influence and evangelize research at all organizational levels.
* Proficiency with research tools and data analytics platforms.


 Mindset
   

  

* A proactive problem-solver who thrives in dynamic environments.
* A collaborative leader with a passion for fostering a research-driven culture.
* A mentor who enjoys empowering others to grow and succeed.


**What We Offer**
* Impact: Shape the future of our product strategy, design, and research processes.
* Growth: Lead a critical transformation within our organisation
* Flexibility: This position can be based out of any of Azets’ 190+ offices across the Nordics, UK, and Ireland. We support flexible remote work but value in-person interactions and expect weekly office attendance. Regular travel for meetings and workshops will also be required
* Culture: Join a collaborative and inclusive work environment that values diverse perspectives and fosters innovation.


**Apply Now**
 If you're ready to drive meaningful change and enable data-informed experiences that empower users, we want to hear from you. Join us at Azets and help us create products that resonate with our customers and set new industry standards.
   

  

**To apply, please submit your resume and a cover letter explaining why you're the ideal candidate for this role.** 
**For more information or questions, contact the recruiting Manager James McConnell, james.mcconnell@azets.com, or HR Manger Erica Lander, erica.lander@azets.com**

title: Fullstackutvecklare till Kundo
description:
Om företaget
 
 Kundo är ett innovativt SaaS-bolag med målet att erbjuda det mest användarvänliga kundservicesystemet på marknaden. Genom att utveckla moderna digitala lösningar för kundservice strävar vi efter att bli Nordens främsta leverantör inom detta område. Vi befinner oss i en bransch som snabbt förändras och där AI-teknologier öppnar dörren för effektivisering och nytänkande. I takt med vår tillväxtresa bygger vi en plattform som sätter AI i centrum för kundservice, och vi söker nu talangfulla medarbetare som vill vara med och forma framtiden för kundservice.
   




 Om tjänsten
 
 Som Senior Fullstack-utvecklare med intresse för AI på Kundo, kommer du att arbeta i ett tvärfunktionellt team som ansvarar för hela tech-stackens utveckling och funktion. Här ligger fokus på både nyutveckling och vidareutveckling av våra kundservicetjänster, där du arbetar med hela processen – från behovsanalys till implementering och uppföljning. Rollen innebär nära samarbete med UX-designers och produktchefer, där du får en nyckelroll i att identifiera kundbehov och skapa innovativa lösningar som gör skillnad.
 



 I den här rollen kommer du även att bidra till våra AI-drivna initiativ, vilket innebär att du får möjlighet att arbeta med den senaste AI-tekniken. Med en mix av Python och JavaScript kommer du att använda din fullstack-kompetens för att skapa en produkt som både är effektiv och användarvänlig, och som levererar verkligt mervärde till våra kunder.
 



**Dina huvudsakliga arbetsuppgifter:** 



* Delta i utvecklingen av vår plattform med fokus på Python (Django/FastAPI) och JavaScript (React) för att skapa smidiga och effektiva lösningar.
* Bidra till design, utveckling och underhåll av AI-baserade system och funktioner, exempelvis LLM, RAG, AI-agenter och pipelines.
* Samarbeta nära med UX-designers och produktchefer för att identifiera kundbehov och utforma lösningar som är i linje med Kundos långsiktiga mål.
* Ta initiativ och leda arbetet från idé till implementering samt utvärdera effekten av de lösningar vi levererar.


 Kvalifikationer och egenskaper
 
 För att lyckas i rollen som Senior Fullstack-utvecklare och AI Engineer tror vi att du har:
 


* Minst 5 års erfarenhet av webbutveckling.
* Erfarenhet av att arbeta i hela stacken med Python (Django/FastAPI) och JavaScript (React).
* Intresse för AI-teknik, samt erfarenhet av att utveckla och underhålla AI-drivna system.
* En stark nyfikenhet och en vilja att utforska nya tekniska lösningar. Du gillar att arbeta kundnära, ta egna initiativ och bidrar gärna med idéer i tidiga produktutvecklingsfaser.



 Tekniker vi arbetar med: Python, Django/FastAPI, React, TypeScript, Elixir/Phoenix, MySQL, Elastic Search, AWS, Kubernetes och RabbitMQ. Erfarenhet av alla dessa tekniker är inte ett krav, men ett plus!
 






 Övrig information
 
 Vi tillämpar löpande urval i denna process vilket innebär att tjänsten kan tillsättas innan sista ansökningsdag. Vi rekommenderar dig därför att ansöka så snart som möjligt!
 



 Har du frågor eller funderingar kring Asta Agencys rekryteringsprocess, tveka inte att höra av dig till jimmy@astaagency.se.
