title: Teamlead SYSOPS till DERTOUR Nordic Apollo
description:
**Teamlead SYSOPS till DERTOUR Nordic (Apollo)**

* Brinner du för SYSOPS på både operativ och taktisk nivå, vill leda ett motiverat team samt älskar att resa på fritiden?
* Vill du bidra till en hög IT-tillgänglighet inom DERTOUR Nordic och därigenom ge våra kunder den bästa kundresan & reseupplevelsen?
* Vill du arbeta i en familjär, varm och omtänksam företagskultur ihop med dedikerade och riktigt kompetenta medarbetare?


Då är rollen som Teamleader SYSOPS på DERTOUR Nordic kanske ditt bästa karriärssteg någonsin, läs gärna vidare.

**Bakgrund**


För oss är IT & utveckling lika viktigt som Grekland och Världen. Att utveckla tjänster och produkter som ger våra slutkunder den bästa upplevelsen, innan, under och efter resan är ständigt i fokus för oss.


Vi söker nu en erfaren Teamledare för SYSOPS som kan säkerställa att vi håller en kontinuerligt hög standard i vår IT-miljö och därigenom också håller en hög produktivitet för DERTOUR Nordic.


Tjänsteplacering kommer att vara på huvudkontoret på Ynglingagatan i Stockholm, här sitter ca 170 av våra medarbetare varav 50 av dessa jobbar inom IT. Du rapporterar till vår Head of IT Operations i Danmark som också är säkerhetskoordinator för BU Nordic. Du kommer att ansvara för tre personer i Stockholm.

**Om tjänsten**


Som Sysops Teamledare så kommer du att representera teamet kring stora såväl som små frågor kopplat till DERTOUR Nordic. Du kommer att arbeta nära verksamheten ihop med utvecklare och andra medlemmar i IT-teamen för att säkerställa hög systemsäkerhet och tillförlitlighet.


Teamet består idag av tre personer där ni gemensamt ansvarar för den dagliga driften av företagets IT-infrastruktur, med övervakning, felsökning av servrar, nätverk och program inklusive distribution och konfiguration av program i en miljö som innefattar AWS, Azure, nätverk, Windows och Linux med mera.


Du kommer även att arbeta med analys av säkerhetshål och riskbedömning i relation till våra säkerhetspolicyer. Detta arbete har precis börjat och vi har en konsult som hjälper oss att bygga upp arbetsprocesserna.


En mindre del av arbetet handlar även om vidareutveckling av system.

**Kvalifikationer & Arbetsuppgifter**


Vi söker dig med hög teknisk kompetens och god överblick kring modern IT-Infrastruktur. Du har troligen **arbetat inom området i plus tio år**.


I denna roll kommer du att verka både operativt och taktiskt, med teamledning, teknik och säkerhet i ungefär lika stora delar av tiden. Du kommer att prioritera tasks samt coacha och stötta teamet dagligen i olika projekt, ansvara för teamets kompetensutveckling samt staka ut riktningen för den tekniska miljön arkitekturellt. Vidare så kommer du att verka för Cloud kostnadseffektivisering samt ha en given plats i DERTOUR´s Security Board.


Din tekniska expertis innehåller:

* AWS Cloud
* Azure & M365
* Systemsäkerhet såsom intrångsdetekteringssystem, backup & återställning
* LAN/WAN
* Patchhantering
* Windows/Linux OS
* Automatisering och Powershellscriptning
* Intresse / kunskap kring IT-Audits processen & ISO 27001 & NIS2
* Goda kunskaper i Excel

**Personlighet**


I denna roll söker vi en driven teamledare och lagspelare som är en kommunikativ, tekniskt kompetent, lösningsfokuserad doer som gillar både människa och teknik.


Då man arbetar verksamhetsnära är förmågan till att utveckla goda relationer samt stort intresse för övriga delar av Apollo viktigt. Apollo andas och lever tillsammans, lagandan är tydlig och man utmanar gärna varandra positivt för att nå framgång. Branschen och DERTOUR Nordic är snabbrörliga, agila och så även du.

**Dina egenskaper**

* Strukturerad, självgående, entusiastisk, kommunikativ och pedagogisk
* Har ett helikopterperspektiv, förutser problem och arbetar proaktivt
* Trivs i och anpassar dig väl i en dynamisk miljö
* Delar med dig av din kunskap, är bra på att ge och ta konstruktiv feedback
* Arbetar med Kontinuerlig förbättring av såväl dig själv som teamet och verksamheten i stort

**Vårt erbjudande**


Vi erbjuder en stimulerande och kreativ arbetsmiljö med varierande arbetsuppgifter som du har stor möjlighet att påverka. Vi har en platt organisation som uppmuntrar samarbete, kommunikation och delande av idéer inom och mellan olika avdelningar på DERTOUR Nordic. Vi erbjuder en arbetsplats där affären är viktigt samtidigt som vi har roligt och en bra balans mellan jobb och privatliv.


Utöver detta kommer du givetvis att erbjudas riktigt bra deals på resor utöver redan schyssta förmåner!

**Kontakt & Ansökan**


I denna rekrytering samarbetar vi med Aliby - The Pink Company. Då intervjuer och urval sker löpande ber vi dig att inte vänta med din ansökan. Vid intresse vänligen kontakta ansvarig rekryteringskonsult. Omar Burazerovic 0728–897441


**Om DERTOUR Nordic**


Apollo, som är den klart största affärsenheten under DERTOUR Nordic är en branschledande researrangör som underlättat för skandinaver att komma ut i världen, först med resor till Grekland till att nu kunna erbjuda hela världen till våra kunder. Vi gör det genom vårt charterbolag Apollo, men även genom våra systerbolag Golf Plaisir, Out of Bounds, Lime Travel och Adventure Specialists.


Med mer än 35 år i branschen så fortsätter vi att växa och söker därför efter fler kompetenta IT-medarbetare som tillsammans med oss vill skapa resebranschens bästa kundresa, oavsett om den sker digitalt eller på en sandstrand i Grekland.


Sedan 2015 är Apollo en del av den privatägda tyska koncernen REWE med över 300 000 medarbetare där DERTOUR är moderbolaget. REWE är stora inom dagligvaruhandel, sällanköp, reseindustrin, med mera. En stark ägare som även har fler andra resebolag i Europa inom koncernen som vi samarbetar med.

title: Marknadskoordinator till Umeå, Skellefteå eller Luleå
description:
##### **Beskrivning**


Avdelningen Marknad & Medlem består av ett team på 5 personer som idag är placerade i Umeå och Luleå. Teamet ansvarar för HSB Norrs marknadsföring, interna och externa kommunikation samt stöttar övriga organisationen i dessa frågor. Avdelningen arbetar även med hållbarhets- och medlemsfrågor samt HSB Norrs varumärke. Vi söker en marknadskoordinator med placeringsort i första hand i Umeå eller Skellefteå men även Luleå är aktuellt.

##### **Arbetsuppgifter**


Som marknadskoordinator i HSB Norr är dina huvudsakliga arbetsuppgifter intern och extern kommunikation samt marknadsföring. Du är ett viktigt stöd till vår affärsdrivande verksamhet i frågor som till exempel:


* Grafisk formgivning, kommunikation och marknadsföring.
* Planering samt löpande publicering och optimering av innehåll i våra sociala kanaler, exempelvis Instagram, Facebook och LinkedIn.
* Planering samt löpande publicering av innehåll i våra digitala kanaler som exempelvis hemsida, inloggat gränssnitt och intranät.
* Skapa annonser och film.
* Artiklar till vår medlemstidning samt digitala utskick.
* Projektledning av evenemang, mässor samt förbättringsarbeten.

##### **Personlig egenskaper**


Vi lägger stor vikt vid dina personliga egenskaper i rekryteringsprocessen och söker därför dig som:

* Tar egna initiativ, är kreativ och idérik samt har en god förmåga att konkretisera avdelningens planer.
* Tycker om att samarbeta, både med ditt närmsta team och med kollegor inom organisationen.
* Uppskattar att arbeta målstyrt och självständigt.
* Är relationsskapande och serviceinriktad både gentemot kunder och kollegor.


Vi söker en engagerad person med god kommunikativ förmåga, både i tal och skrift. Rollen som marknadskoordinator är bred och vi tror att du trivs i en roll med många kontaktytor där den ena dagen inte är den andra lik.


##### **Kvalifikationer**


Vi söker dig som har:


* Utbildning eller likvärdig erfarenhet inom kommunikation, marknadsföring samt grafisk formgivning.
* Erfarenhet inom sociala kanaler, såsom Instagram, Facebook och LinkedIn.
* Erfarenhet inom Adobe Creative Cloud, i huvudsak InDesign och Photoshop.
* Intresse av att arbeta med digitala kanaler.
* Mycket god förmåga att uttala dig i tal och skrift på svenska.
* B-körkort.

**Meriterande:**  

* Kunskaper inom filmredigering.
* Erfarenhet av projektledning.

##### **Vi erbjuder dig**


Vill du arbeta i ett företag där utveckling, sunda värderingar och eget ansvar är viktigt? På HSB Norr kan vi erbjuda ett stimulerande arbete i en utvecklingsdriven organisation med värderingarna i centrum och fokus på att ständigt utveckla det goda boendet. Med den rätta ambitionen och stark drivkraft är en anställning inom HSB en bra investering i din karriär. Möjligheterna finns hos HSB!

##### **Villkor**


Tjänsten kommer vara placerad på vårt kontor i centrala Umeå, Skellefteå eller Luleå. Tjänsten är en tillsvidareanställning på heltid och du arbetar vanligtvis vardagar, dagtid. Tillträde sker enligt överenskommelse.


I denna rekrytering arbetar vi med löpande urval vilket innebär att vi kan komma att kalla till anställningsintervju innan ansökningstiden har gått ut.

**Sista ansökningsdag är** **27 november** **2024**.


##### **Vill du veta mer?**


Vänligen kontakta **Teamchef Marknad & Medlem Christine Aspgren** på telefon **070-254 46 43** eller christine.aspgren@hsb.se.


Facklig kontaktperson för Unionen är Joakim Eklöf; tfn 010-303 21 27 eller mail joakim.eklof@hsb.se.

##### **Om HSB Norr**

*HSB Norr är den nordligaste av de regionala HSB-föreningarna och verkar från Umeå i söder till Kiruna i norr. Vi ägs av våra ca 40 000 medlemmar och vårt uppdrag är att tillsammans skapa det goda, hållbara boendet. Vårt tjänsteutbud är brett och innefattar förvaltningstjänster och tjänster inom fastighetsutveckling, nyproducerade bostadsrätter, hyresrätter, bosparande och medlemskap för bostadsrättsföreningar och individuella medlemmar. Vi arbetar för ökad resurseffektivitet, minskad klimatpåverkan samt utveckling av hållbara tjänster och produkter. HSB är också en viktig samhällsaktör som bidrar till ett inkluderande samhälle som värdesätter jämställdhet och mångfald.*

*Delar du vår passion för att skapa framtidens hållbara boenden?*

*Vill du läsa mer om oss på HSB Norr, gå gärna in på vår hemsida* *https://jobb.hsb.se/pages/hsb-norr* *och få mer information gällande förmåner och roller.*

title: DATA ANALYST, RETAIL DATA & MACHINE LEARNING, DIGITAL CHANNELS AND COMMERCE, GROUP DIGITAL, INGKA GROUP
description:
**Job ID:** 264877


**Date posted:** 06/11/2024


**Who you are**  

  

We are looking for a Data Analyst to join us in building outstanding digital products for the many customers and co-workers in the omni capabilities area. Our team is at the fore front of digital product development by understanding the behavior of our customers and co-workers better than anyone else. This role is the ideal mixture of performing deep-dive analysis and building dashboards to steer digital product development.  

  

This role is part of Selling and Payments Insights Team within the Digital Channel & Commerce domain, and we would love to talk with you, if you recognize yourself in some of the following:  

  

* Passionate about understanding business problems and applying data analytics to solve them.
* You are in love with working with large amounts of data, exploring the challenges and redefining

how we can improve our digital products.  

* Experience in developing data and statistics-driven solutions for real-life business problems.
* Love being creative through code (SQL is a must, Python a welcome addition)
* Can formulate hypotheses from the data you use.
* Love (data) storytelling and using visualizations of data to explain facts.
* are experienced in developing easy to use BI dashboards in different tools (Power BI, Looker

Studio...)  

* Have a strong background in math, computer science, engineering or equivalent (at least MS or

equivalent)  

* Have experience leading the development of advanced analytics frameworks within large

organizations.  

* Have experience working in some of the following areas: customer analytics, personalization,

analytics, online customer journeys, etc. (ideally in a retail setting.)  

* Are a team player who takes ownership, builds cross-functional relationships with peers, and loves

sharing data knowledge with other coworkers.  

* Proactively manage relevant stakeholders and/or teams to drive an intended outcome.
* Are curious, self-directed and want to keep learning!

  

This is our wish list! If you don’t recognize yourself in one or more of these points, you might still be an excellent candidate for the role. We like to think long-term and invest in people’s development together with us.  

  

The IKEA culture and values are very much a part of our business and day-to-day work life. For you to thrive and grow with IKEA it’s important for us that you share our values! You can read more regarding our values and life at IKEA on our website www.ikea.com.  

  

**What you'll be doing day to day**  

  

You’ll play a vital role in digital product development with a more data-driven approach by ensuring that data insights become a natural part of the organizational workflow and impact present and future decisions on business and product strategy. This means:-  

  

* Generate actionable insights to help your stakeholders make better-informed decisions.
* Find metrics / build KPI framework to better understand how our digital products are, thus

monitoring the impact on business.  

* Explore data to find challenges and translate them into potential opportunities by forming

hypotheses  

* Support data engineers and data scientists to build simplified, easy-to-use, data products for

various coworkers.  

* Create presentations in a real storytelling mode that inspires stakeholders.

  

Perhaps you have your own questions to ask? Our goal is to create a better everyday life for the many people by creating a unique partnership with each customer. To achieve this, we are enhancing our omni capabilities, using data-driven insights and advanced analytics to create value throughout the entire customer journey.  

  

**Our team within IKEA**  

  

You will work in Data & Analytics team together with other Data Analysts, Data Scientists, Data Engineers, Data Stewards, ML Engineers and Data Architects. Together you will be joining cross-functional teams consisting of colleagues from Technology, Product and Design, that design, implement and deploy products that help to solve these kinds of problems. It will be a mix of product insights, data visualization and writing code – as well as talking with product owners and business stakeholders.  

  

IKEA has long been a global leader in home furnishing. We are proud of our vision to improve the everyday life of the many people. But our industry is quickly changing, and we need to adapt to stay competitive.  

  

As part of IKEA’s journey to strengthen our digital products, we are building a Data & Analytics function. Selling & Payment Insights team is working on challenges across the different aspects of payments, commerce and IKEA Experience Platform, with end goal to provide a better experience for our customers across different channels.
  

  

We see so many opportunities for what we can accomplish and have the ambition to be a world-class team. At the same time, we believe that our work is not just about building models, but also about learning and having fun together.  

  

We can offer you:  

  

* Work on some very interesting problems as described above, and you are encouraged to spot new

opportunities or to collaborate with Data Analytics colleagues in other specialist teams.  

* Opportunities to have a global impact on your work.
* Flexible and modern tools: we deploy on Google Cloud Platform, and we use a lot of open-source

tools across the board.  

* Hardware and OS of your choice.
* A team of great colleagues to learn with and from (with world-class experience across all aspects

of Data Analytics).  

* Continuous learning (we aim to spend 20% of our working time on learning).
* Flexible and friendly working environment.

  

**Questions and support? Let's connect!**  

  

Does this sound like your next challenge? IKEA offers an exciting and empowering work environment in a global workplace. And as the world’s leader in life at home, you have exceptional opportunities to grow and develop together with us.  

  

If you have questions regarding the recruitment system, please reach out to Annette Björkquist-Åhstedt at annette.bjorkquist-ahstedt@ingka.ikea.com. Please apply with your application in English. Note that we can’t process any applications through email.  

  

We look forward to learning more about you!  

  

Thank you!
company_description: At IKEA, we share an inspiring vision: “to create a better everyday life for the many people”.

title: System Developer
description:
Viedoc designs engaging software for the life science industry. By acceleratingclinical trials on all levels, Viedoc’s solutions support major pharmaceutical,biotech, and medical device companies, as well as renowned researchinstitutions worldwide. Headquartered in Uppsala, Sweden, Viedoc also hasoffices in America, France, Japan, Vietnam, and China. Since Viedoc’s inceptionin 2003, over 1 million patients in more than 75 countries have participated instudies powered by Viedoc.
   

  

**Who We Are And What We Do**
 At Viedoc, we design engaging software that modernizes clinical research so that necessary treatments can reach the people who need them faster.
   

  

 We accomplish this by combining technology and a creative design to streamline, automate and simplify conventional processes within clinical research. Simply put, Viedoc makes every aspect of a clinical study a bit smoother, resulting in greater discoveries that make a difference, and has the potential to improve lives.
   

  

 Real change means challenging the status quo – our driving force since we started almost two decades ago. In everything we do, we work for a healthier world, searching for better, more efficient solutions that answer to the needs of both our users and humanity.
   

  

**What You Will Do And Why**
 As a Software Developer, you will be part of an enthusiastic and close-knit team with other developers, product owners, and testers, whose ambition is to constantly develop the product and themselves. Together with your team, you will work with everything from product discovery to architecture-related issues. You will work agile and put information security and quality first. Our Tech Stack includes .NET, C#, JavaScript/React, Azure, Docker, and Serverless.
   

  

**This Means You Will Be Responsible For**
* Collaborating with developers, product owners, and testers to deliver high-quality software solutions.
* Participating in all stages of development, from product discovery to deployment and maintenance.
* Ensuring information security and quality are prioritized throughout the development process.
* Contributing to system architecture decisions and addressing performance and scalability challenges.
* Working in an agile team, participating in sprints, stand-ups, and continuous improvement processes.


**Who are you?**
**About**
 We believe that you are passionate about software development. You love sharing your knowledge and want to celebrate both the small and the groundbreaking product breakthroughs with us. We also want you to have:
   

  

* At least 3-5 years of experience within software development
* Good knowledge of and experience in .NET/C#, JavaScript, and cloud technology
* Relevant education within IT or equivalent work experience
* Fluent in English, both speech and writing


**Why you should work at** 
**Viedoc**
* Be a part of a company that is at the forefront of utilizing technology to make the world a better place by improving clinical trials
* Ability to work flexible hours and hybrid remote
* Clearly defined development plans that allow you to grow
* The chance to work in the coolest office in Uppsala right by the central station


**Interested?**
 If you want to join our team, apply! Want to know more about why our product is important?
 **Check out the video on this page**

title: Marketing Specialist
description:
**Marcolin** 
 is a worldwide leading group in the eyewear industry founded in 1961 in the heart of the Veneto district, Italy. It stands out for the unique ability to combine craftsmanship with advanced technologies through the constant pursuit of excellence and continuous innovation. The portfolio includes house brands (WEB EYEWEAR, ic! berlin), as well as licensed brands: TOM FORD, Guess, adidas Sport, adidas Originals, Christian Louboutin, Max Mara, Zegna, GCDS, MAX&Co., MCM, Tod's, Pucci, BMW, K-Way®, Kenneth Cole, Abercrombie & Fitch, Timberland, GANT, Harley-Davidson, Marciano and Skechers. Through its own direct network and global partners, Marcolin distributes its products in more than 125 countries. At the end of 2023, Marcolin Group counted about 2,000 employees and net sales of €558.3 million.
 



 www.marcolin.com
 



  





**Location:** 
 Stockholm
 



  





 Marcolin Nordic AB is looking for a talented
 **Marketing Specialist** 
 to join our Nordic Marketing Team. This role is based in Sweden with some travel required in the Scandinavian region. Please understand you must have the correct and full Right to work in Sweden to apply.
 



  





 Reporting to the North EMEA Marketing Manager, you will primarily be responsible for supporting the group on all marketing and event initiatives while working closely with brand management, sales team, customer service and logistic department.
 



  





 This position offers you the opportunity to work for internationally renowned brands, get involved in all areas of the business and gain comprehensive knowledge of the market and of different aspects of B2B marketing.
 



  





**Responsibilities:** 



* Participate in all marketing activities according to the guidelines of the Italian HQ.
* Ensure marketing content, including advertising campaigns, videos, and digital assets, are updated and shared with customers, both online and offline.
* Plan and distribute POP Material, including bespoke window dressing and in-store visibility for strategic customers.
* Organize and execute events, trade shows and sales meetings.
* Budget reporting and analysis.
* Build relationships with the sales team, constantly updating on ongoing projects.
* Create content and presentations for the delivery of product and brand training to customers and brand representatives.
* Create customer journeys and campaigns through Salesforce Marketing Cloud.
* Collaboration with the external PR agency.



  





**Requirements:** 



* Degree in marketing or comparable education.
* 1-2 years of relevant work experience in a similar role, ideally in the Fashion or FMCG industry.
* Excellent communication, presentation, writing and analytical skills.
* Proficiency in the use of Microsoft Office: Excel, Word, PowerPoint, Outlook, SharePoint and Teams.
* Knowledge of Salesforce Marketing Cloud and experience in digital marketing and/or CRM will will be considered a plus.
* Experience in project and event management and passion for delivering engaging events.
* Ability to take initiative, recognize and act on opportunities, work by priority in a fast-paced environment.
* Must be proactive, results-oriented, and able to learn and work independently.
* Excellent organizational skills and good team player.
* Experience working in an internationally distributed team, or interest in developing global experience.



  





**What´s in for you?** 



* A versatile job with development opportunities in an international fashion and luxury company with a portfolio of more than 20 brands and more than 60 years of experience on the market.
* A working atmosphere based on partnership in a successful company, with short decision-making processes and flat hierarchies.
* An office in Stockholm with a collegial working atmosphere.
* Competitive salary, bonus scheme, free products.



  





**Type of position** 
 :
 



 This is a fixed term position for a Maternity leave coverage role.
 



  





 We look forward to receiving your application, including your salary expectations and possible start date.
 



  





**Marcolin** 
 guarantees equal opportunities. This company does not discriminate against applicants on the basis of race, gender, age, disability, religion, national origin, or any other aspect prohibited by applicable law.

title: Senior Technician
description:
Senior tekniker/arkitekt till konsultuppdrag hos Fujitsu
 



  





**Plats:** 
 Kista, Stockholm (delvis på distans – minst 2 dagar/vecka på kontoret)
 



**Omfattning:** 
 Heltid, 100 %
 



**Start:** 
 Omgående
 



**Slutdatum:** 
 2025-05-30, med möjlighet till förlängning
 



  





**Om rollen:** 




 Vi söker en erfaren
 **Teknisk Arkitekt** 
 eller
 **Senior Tekniker** 
 för att stärka vårt team inom Hybrid IT Services. I denna roll kommer du primärt att arbeta med lösningsframtagning för merförsäljning till våra befintliga kunder, med särskilt fokus på offentlig sektor. Rollen innebär ett nära samarbete med kunderna där du ansvarar för att besvara förfrågningar och delta i implementation av lösningar.
 



  





**Dina arbetsuppgifter kommer att inkludera:** 



* Framtagning av lösningar för att möta kundernas specifika behov och krav.
* Implementation och konfiguration av system för att säkerställa en framgångsrik lösning.
* Aktivt delta i utvecklingen av vårt tjänsteutbud för befintliga kunder inom publik sektor.



  





**Krav och erfarenhet:** 



* **Språk:** 
 Mycket god svenska i tal och skrift är ett krav.
* **Bakgrundskontroll:** 
 Krav på godkänd bakgrundskontroll.



  





**Teknisk kompetens:** 




 Du behöver ha omfattande erfarenhet inom följande områden:
 


* **VMware:** 
 Konfiguration och managering.
* **Klient- och applikationshantering:** 
 Installation, konfiguration och managering.
* **Databaser:** 
 Konfiguration och managering.
* **Operativsystem (Linux & Windows):** 
 Konfiguration och managering.
* **Active Directory (inkl. DHCP, DNS, ADFS):** 
 Konfiguration och managering.
* **Fileserver:** 
 Konfiguration och managering.
* **Zabbix:** 
 Monitorering och managering.
* **Skriptning:** 
 Erfarenhet av PS, VB, Pearl och Python.
* **Defender:** 
 Konfiguration och managering.



  





**Grundläggande förståelse inom:** 



* Nätverk
* Lastbalansering
* HyperV
* Puppet
* IIS
* SharePoint
* Exchange



  





**Meriterande kunskaper (ej krav):** 



* Azure Server: Konfiguration och managering.
* Azure AD: Konfiguration och managering.
* Azure Administration.



  





**Varför ansöka?** 




 Här får du chansen att vara en del av ett innovativt team på Fujitsu, där du kan sätta din tekniska expertis i spel och bidra till avancerade lösningar för offentliga sektorn. Som Teknisk Arkitekt eller Senior Tekniker blir du en nyckelspelare i att vidareutveckla och förbättra kundlösningar, samtidigt som du får möjlighet att arbeta med spännande teknik och vidareutveckla dina färdigheter inom hybrid IT. Med flexibla arbetsmöjligheter och ett starkt fokus på samarbete erbjuder Fujitsu en dynamisk och stimulerande arbetsmiljö där din insats gör skillnad.

title: Customer Engineer, Cloud Security
job_function: Sales, General Business, and Customer Service
company_industry: Information Services and Technology, Information and Internet
description:
**Minimum qualifications:**
* Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience.
* 10 years of experience in in selling security consulting services in the capacity of a technical business engineer in a cloud computing environment, or equivalent experience in a similar customer-facing role (e.g., within a professional services, solutions architect, or systems engineering team).
* Experience in cybersecurity technical solutions: SIEM/SOAR (EDR, XDR), Threat Intelligence (threat detection, malware intelligence, attack surface management), Cloud Security (CSPM, CWPP, CNAPP, or identity and access management systems).


**Preferred qualifications:**
* Certification in the Cloud or Security industry.
* Experience in either of these market sectors: retail, healthcare, energy or chemicals.
* Knowledge of product and solution market trends in the cybersecurity industry (e.g., ransomware, attack frameworks, zero trust, etc.).
* Ability to speak publicly and deliver technical presentations.
* Ability to travel up to 50% of the time as required.


**About The Job**
 The Google Cloud Platform team helps customers transform and build what's next for their business — all with technology built in the cloud. Our products are developed for security, reliability and scalability, running the full stack from infrastructure to applications to devices and hardware. Our teams are dedicated to helping our customers — developers, small and large businesses, educational institutions and government agencies — see the benefits of our technology come to life. As part of an entrepreneurial team in this rapidly growing business, you will play a key role in understanding the needs of our customers and help shape the future of businesses of all sizes use technology to connect with customers, employees and partners.
   

  

 Google Cloud accelerates every organization’s ability to digitally transform its business and industry. We deliver enterprise-grade solutions that leverage Google’s cutting-edge technology, and tools that help developers build more sustainably. Customers in more than 200 countries and territories turn to Google Cloud as their trusted partner to enable growth and solve their most critical business problems.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
* Work with Security, Business and Google Cloud teams to identify and qualify business opportunities, understand customer technical and compliance objections, and develop strategies to resolve technical blockers.
* Work with all Google Cloud Security products to demonstrate and validate solution benefits in customer and partner environments.
* Support Google Cloud Security opportunities and relationships, own technical aspects of solutions, deliver technical presentations, product and solution briefings, proofs-of-concepts and demos to customers, partners, and stakeholders.
* Prepare and deliver product messaging in an effort to highlight Google's solutions value proposition using techniques including presentations, product demonstrations, white papers, trial management, and response documents.
* Travel to customer sites, conferences, and other related events where applicable.


 Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing our Accommodations for Applicants form .

title: Senior Infrastructure Cloud Architect, Professional Services
AI Infrastructure Engineer
company_industry: IT Services and IT Consulting and Business Consulting and Services
description:
What makes Cognizant a unique place to work? The combination of rapid growth and an international and innovative environment! This is creating a lot of opportunities for people like YOU — people with an entrepreneurial spirit who want to make a difference in this world.
   

  

 At Cognizant, together with your colleagues from all around the world, you will collaborate on creating solutions for the world's leading companies and help them become more flexible, more innovative and successful. And this is your chance to be part of the success story: we are looking for an AI Infrastructure Engineer to join our Artificial Intelligence & Analytics practice.
   

  

**Cognizant’s Artificial Intelligence & Analytics practice**
 Our practice Artificial Intelligence & Analytics is a global practice working across more than 15 verticals including, Banking & Financial Services, Healthcare, Retail, Consumer Goods & Insurance to deliver cutting edge solutions for their data & analytics requirements.
   

  

 We specialize in leading technology trends in market like cloud analytics, data modernization, Generative AI & AI/ML solutions.
   

  

**About The Role**
 We are seeking an experienced Generative AI Infrastructure Engineer with expertise in Azure Open AI and AKS to join our team. As a Generative AI Infrastructure Engineer, you will be responsible for designing, building, and maintaining the infrastructure required to support the development and deployment of generative AI models on Azure. This includes developing and managing large-scale computing systems, data storage and processing systems, and software frameworks that enable the efficient and scalable training of generative AI models.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* Design and implement large-scale computing systems on Azure that can handle the demands of training and deploying generative AI models
* Design and implement data storage and processing systems on Azure that can handle the large amounts of data required for training and deploying generative AI models.
* Develop software frameworks that enable the efficient and scalable training of generative AI models on Azure.
* Collaborate with data scientists to ensure that the infrastructure meets the requirements of the generative AI models.
* Troubleshoot and optimize the performance of the infrastructure to ensure that it is running efficiently and effectively.
* Develop and maintain documentation of the infrastructure and its components.
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure that the infrastructure is aligned with the company's goals and objectives


**Requirements**
* Knowledge in designing and implementing large-scale computing systems, data storage and processing systems, and software frameworks on Azure.
* You must have experience with Azure Open AI, including Azure Machine Learning, Azure Databricks, and Azure Cognitive Services
* Experience with AKS container, including containerization, orchestration, and management.
* Strong programming skills in languages such as Python, Java, or C++.
* Communication skills are required to collaborate with cross-functional teams.


**What You Can Expect**
* Become part of a ‘flag ship’ success story - We go through enormous growth!
* Organization driven by technology – We have a tremendous technology backbone
* Environment where you can make your own ideas reality
* Drive your own career
* Market conforms benefits


 Please contact Cajsa for more information: Cajsa.orvenholt@cognizant.com

title: Salesforce CTO - Nordics
description:
Are you ready to make a real impact? Join our Nordic Salesforce Center of Excellence (COE) as our Salesforce CTO!
   

  

 As part of one of the top 5 global Salesforce partners, you will play a crucial role in shaping our Nordic market and clients while being part of our global Salesforce community and CTO Network. This position offers an exceptional opportunity to collaborate and exchange knowledge with a fast-growing community of Salesforce experts. To grow and further strengthen our organization, we are looking for a qualified Salesforce CTO to engage as lead architect in complex multi-cloud, enterprise-scale transformations and sales pursuits.
   

  

**About The Role**
 As the Salesforce CTO for the Nordics, you will use your vast experience and expertise to make an impact across these areas:
   

  

* Business Growth: Build winning proposals and offers backed by innovative solutions, modern delivery approaches, and competitive estimations. Guide CxOs in their decision process to select Salesforce technology and/or Capgemini as their trusted transformation partner within Digital Customer Experience (DCX).
* Delivery Quality Assurance: Shape and participate in design authority and advisory roles across strategic Nordic Salesforce engagements to oversee the realization of proposed target and transition architectures, ensuring long-term scalable and cost-efficient solutions that meet the business objectives of our clients. In this aspect you will also manage own chargeability of 50%.
* Curate and Deploy Salesforce Assets and Accelerators: Promote and position Capgemini’s global offers and accelerators, adapting assets for deployment in the local market or customer context.
* Provide Thought Leadership and Community Building: Mentor, activate, and grow the Salesforce architect community within Capgemini Nordics, nurturing future CX architects.


**YOUR PROFILE**
* Expertise in Solution Selling: Proven track record in crafting innovative and scalable solutions within the CX and CRM domain, developing winning proposals, leading bid submissions, and presenting pitches effectively while managing risk related to the sales process.
* C-Suite Engagement: Comfortable driving discussions at the c-suite level, managing objections, and defending your position. Excellent verbal and written communication skills, with executive-level presentation and facilitation experience.
* Enterprise Architecture and Delivery Experience: Extensive experience in leading or working within an enterprise architecture function at the intersection of business and technology, focusing on capabilities in Customer Experience (Sales, Service, Marketing, Commerce, Analytics, and beyond). Functional and technical knowledge of CRM domains and solutions. Experience working in large-scale, national/international transformation initiatives with complex, multi-vendor, multi-stakeholder, and multi-country delivery structures.
* Integration Expertise: Experience from designing internal and/or external integrations with the Salesforce platform; experience with Mulesoft integration framework is a plus.
* Governance and Risk Management: Skilled in implementing architectural governance, managing issues and risks related to the realization of target architecture.
* People Leadership, Mentorship, and Talent Development: Proven track record of leading and mentoring other architects and technical teams in global organizations.
* Industry Relevance: Deep understanding of industries such as Telco, Energy, Public Sector, Automotive, and Manufacturing.
* Multi-Vendor Solutions Knowledge: Understanding of competitive and complementary technologies to Salesforce, with the ability to evaluate pros and cons and defend Salesforce’s value proposition.
* Strategic Partnerships: Strong relationships within key strategic partner ecosystems, including partners, vendors, and experts, with an active network.
* IT and Salesforce Experience: 10+ years of overall IT experience with 5+ years of experience on Salesforce technology related to multi-cloud architecture and the entire delivery lifecycle.
* Salesforce Certification: Salesforce Technical Architecture certification or ambition to achieve it in the near future.
* Hands-On Development and Problem-Solving: Hands-on development and configuration background with a consultancy approach to problem-solving. Expertise in Development Life Cycle and DevOps applied to the Salesforce platform.
* Language Skills: Fluent in English.


**What We Believe You Will Enjoy About Working Here**
* We recognize the significance of flexible work arrangements to provide support. Be it remote work, or flexible work hours, you will get an environment to maintain healthy work life balance.
* At the heart of our mission is your career growth. Our array of career growth programs and diverse professions are crafted to support you in exploring a world of opportunities.
* Generous wellness allowance, private medical insurance, and occupational pension
* Tech communities
* Certification bonus


**About Capgemini**
 Capgemini is a global business and technology transformation partner, helping organizations to accelerate their dual transition to a digital and sustainable world, while creating tangible impact for enterprises and society. It is a responsible and diverse group of 340,000 team members in more than 50 countries. With its strong over 55-year heritage, Capgemini is trusted by its clients to unlock the value of technology to address the entire breadth of their business needs. It delivers end-to-end services and solutions leveraging strengths from strategy and design to engineering, all fueled by its market leading capabilities in AI, cloud and data, combined with its deep industry expertise and partner ecosystem. The Group reported 2023 global revenues of €22.5 billion.
   

  

 Get The Future You Want | www.capgemini.com

title: Data Management Architect
description:
**Company Description**
 We are a consulting company with a bunch of technology-interested and happy people!
   

  

 We love technology, we love design and we love quality. Our diversity makes us unique and creates an inclusive and welcoming workplace where each individual is highly valued.
   

  

 With us, each individual is her/himself and respects others for who they are and we believe that when a fantastic mix of people gather and share their knowledge, experiences and ideas, we can help our customers on a completely different level.
   

  

 We are looking for you who want to grow with us!
   

  

 With us, you have great opportunities to take real steps in your career and the opportunity to take great responsibility.
   

  

**Job Description**
 This is a unique opportunity for you to take part in defining the data management capabilities within company. You will take the lead in designing the target architecture for our data management capabilities that aim to enable a unified data ecosystem that serves the needs of the enterprise. You will need to evaluate the current capabilities and tooling in order to arrive at a proposal for the future state we are able to provide fit for purpose data for both operational and analytical use of data. You will do this in collaboration with our data governance specialists and information architects who lead the implementation of federated data governance for the company. In this role you will be a part of Business Tech and belonging to the Data Governance & Community Unit within the AI, Analytics and Data Tech Center.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
 In the role of a Data Management Architect within the company you can expect to work with following topics:
   

  

* Do a high level analysis of current data management capabilities and tooling. Existing pre-studies have been done in different knowledge areas, e.g. Master Data Management, but an overall estimation is needed in order to define a future state.
* Drive the work for defining a target architecture for data management capabilities, with a high level roadmap suggestion for potential tech investments.
* Drive collection of requirements during the course of the work in order to prepare for an RFI/RFP for potential tech investments.
* Act as subject matter expert for data management, educating the team and the organization as a whole in the different areas of data management and how these areas will need to collaborate in order to achieve fit for purpose data.


**Qualifications**
 You are a true expert in data management with a holistic view on how data management and data governance collaborate and enable our business to drive value from data. You are well up to date with current data management tooling available on the market and follow latest trends carefully. We believe that you are communicative, curious, and structured. You have the ability to navigate a tech organization as well as act as a trusted partner towards business.
   

  

 We believe that you possess the following skills and experiences:
   

  

* Experience in implementing data management and data governance in large global enterprises.
* Experience in driving target architecture work within data management.
* Experience in driving pre-studies and RFI/RFP work for acquiring technology.
* Experience and detailed understanding about available tooling for data management and governance, and preferably hands on experience from working with some of the tools.
* Excellent verbal communication and documentation capacity in English.


 It is beneficial if you have previous experience from project management and agile way of working.
   

  

**What We Can Offer**
 This is a fulltime position with placement in Stockholm. You will report to Data Governance and Community Unit Lead at AI, Analytics and Data Tech Center. We have a strong, value-driven culture characterized by believing in people, teamwork, and an entrepreneurial spirit. Youll be part of an important initiative in the company with significant opportunities to influence and make a difference.
   

  

****Additional Information****
**Start:** 
 Immediately
   

  

**Location:** 
 Stockholm
   

  

**Form of employment:** 
 Full-time until further notice, we apply 6 months probationary employment
   

  

 We interview candidates continuously, so please do not wait to submit your application.

title: Data Engineer
description:
**Hej, Truecaller is calling you from Stockholm, Sweden! Ready to pick up?**
 Our goal is to make communication smarter, safer, and more efficient, all while building trust everywhere. We're all about bringing you smart services with a big social impact, keeping you safe from fraud, harassment, scam calls or messages, so you can focus on the conversations that matter.
   

  

* Top 20 most downloaded apps globally, and world's #1 caller ID and spam-blocking service for Android and iOS, with extensive AI capabilities, with more than 400 million active users per month.
* Founded in 2009 with an impressive year-on-year growth with high profitability, listed on Nasdaq OMX Stockholm, Large Cap.
* Founded in 2009, listed on Nasdaq OMX Stockholm and is categorized as a Large Cap. Our focus on innovation, operational excellence, sustainable growth, and collaboration has resulted in consistently high profitability and strong EBITDA margins.
* A team of 400 people from ~35 different nationalities spread across our headquarters in Stockholm and offices in Bangalore, Mumbai, Gurgaon, and Tel Aviv with high ambitions.


**We at the Infrastructure team,** 
 work on a vision to empower our product-oriented teams with a complete self-service analytics platform to make data-driven decisions possible in Truecaller, guaranteeing the stability, velocity, and delivery of the mainstream events pipeline.
   

  

**As a Data Engineer** 
 , you will play an important role in the Data Platform team which is responsible for building and maintaining a scalable, robust, self-service analytics platform.
   

  

**What do we expect from you:**
* 3+ years of experience in data engineering
* Experience working with orchestration tool (ex: Airflow)
* Experience working with a large data set
* Experience building complex ETL pipelines
* Experience working with cloud providers such as GCP, AWS, or Azure
* Strong programming skills in Spark with Scala and Python
* Experience working with CI/CD tools like Jenkins and Git
* Strong understanding of Software Engineering practices and principles
* Excellent problem-solving and communication skills
* Self-motivated and have a proven ability to take initiative to own the problems that come up and solve them


**What will you work on**
* Maintaining and improving the ingestion pipeline to reliably deliver billions of events daily in defined SLA
* Provide support for all teams in building and optimizing their complex pipelines
* Work closely with other teams to identify pain points and problems around the platform
* Develop new tools and frameworks to improve the data platform
* Facilitate company-wide to be data-driven
* Work in close collaboration with data scientists and data analysts to help support their work in production
* Work with vast projects such as building an ML platform and streaming use cases
* Setup best practices and processes around software and data development


**It would be great if you also have**
* Working with messaging systems like Kafka
* Knowledge in Kubernetes
* Hands-on experience with any streaming platform
* Experience managing data warehouse in BigQuery or Redshift


 Life at Truecaller - Behind the code: https://www.instagram.com/lifeattruecaller/
   

  

 Sounds like your dream job?
   

  

 We will fill the position as soon as we find the right candidate, so please send your application as soon as possible. As part of the recruitment process, we will conduct a background check.
   

  

 This position is based in Stockholm, Sweden.
   

  

 We only accept applications in English.
   

  

**What we offer:**
* **A smart, talented, and agile team:** 
 An international team where ~35 nationalities are working together in several locations and time zones with a learning, sharing, and fun environment.
* **A great compensation package:** 
 Competitive salary, 30 days of paid vacation, flexible working hours, private health insurance, parental leave top-up, pension contribution, Udemy membership to keep learning and improving, and free gym membership.
* **Great tech tools:** 
 Pick the computer and phone you most fancy within our budget ranges.
* Office life: We strongly believe in in-person collaboration and follow an office-first approach while offering some flexibility. Enjoy your days with great colleagues with loads of good stuff to learn from, and a wide range of yummy snacks and beverages. In addition, now and then check out the playroom for a fun break or join our exciting parties and or team activities such as Lab days, Running team, movie nights in our cinema, or a Geek lunch. There is something for everyone!


**Come as you are:**
 Truecaller is diverse, equal, and inclusive. We need a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, beliefs, and experiences to keep building our great products. No matter where you are based, which language you speak, your accent, race, religion, color, nationality, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, etc. All those things make you who you are, and that's why we would love to meet you.

title: Software Development Intern
description:
**Job Description**
 Java is one of the most popular programming languages in the world and it runs on billions of devices scaling from credit cards to multi-machine servers. Oracle is the main contributor to the Java programming language, developed through the OpenJDK project. The Java Virtual Machine (JVM) is the core piece of technology that enables Java’s “write once, run anywhere” - the ability to run the same Java program on multiple hardware architectures and operating systems without having to recompile the code.
   

  

 The JVM also implements the Java memory management with Garbage Collectors (GCs) that handle all the details for you, and just-in-time (JIT) compilers that enable Java performance to be better than what is possible with any statically compiled language.We are now looking for talented, purpose-focused, and highly motivated collaborators for an internship in the Stockholm development office.
   

  

 The goal of this project is to achieve faster compilation times, more precise GC barrier elision opportunities, more maintainable and less fragile code, possibly even more efficient GC barrier implementations by going lower level than a CPU agnostic IR, and hopefully getting to a more standardized way of emitting GC barriers instead of all GCs doing different things as it is today.
   

  

 This will be achieved by building a GC barrier infrastructure for the G1 GC similar to what has already been done for Generational ZGC. GC barriers are machine code instructions used to help perform bookkeeping required to maintain invariants. This project involves injecting the machine instructions for GC barriers at the very late instruction emission phase of the C2 JIT compiler, instead of the very early bytecode parsing phase where it is emitted today.
   

  

 By emitting the GC barriers very early as done today, optimization phases throughout the compilers (e.g. escape analysis) currently needs to recognize that it should do something different for GC barrier Intermediate Representation (IR) nodes, as opposed to general application IR. The new approach doesn’t add any IR nodes for the GC barriers at all, and hence doesn’t introduce such complexity to the compiler design.The new feature should be implemented for the x64 and aarch64 CPU targets, likely to involve low level architecture specific optimization of the machine instruction sequences, as well as high level optimizations on the IR level to elide unnecessary GC barriers
   

  

**Requirements-**
 Good communication and presentation skills in English.- Experience in computer science fundamentals.- Experience with modern IDEs and version control (Git).- C++ programming skills and experience with assembly.- Good problem-solving skills.- Experience with the Java Virtual Machine (Specification) is a plus.- Garbage Collection and Compiler development expertise is a plus.
   

  

 Career Level - IC0
   

  

**About Us**
 As a world leader in cloud solutions, Oracle uses tomorrow’s technology to tackle today’s problems. True innovation starts with diverse perspectives and various abilities and backgrounds.
   

  

 When everyone’s voice is heard, we’re inspired to go beyond what’s been done before. It’s why we’re committed to expanding our inclusive workforce that promotes diverse insights and perspectives.
   

  

 We’ve partnered with industry-leaders in almost every sector—and continue to thrive after 40+ years of change by operating with integrity.

We offer a highly competitive suite of employee benefits designed on the principles of parity and consistency. We put our people first with flexible medical, life insurance and retirement options. We also encourage employees to give back to their communities through our volunteer programs.

title: Salesforce Architect
description:
At Tobii Dynavox, we empower people with disabilities to do what they once did or never thought possible. We call this mission Power to Be You. Our assistive communication technology helps our customers express themselves, connect with the world, and pursue independence, whether through everyday activities like ordering food or extraordinary feats like running a company. Working at Tobii Dynavox, you’ll become part of a team that spans the globe, with offices in the US, Sweden, the UK, China, and beyond.
   

  

 To learn more about what we make possible,
 **meet some of our customers** 
 or
 **take a look at some of our products** 
 .
   

  

**Salesforce Architect**
 We are seeking a seasoned Salesforce Architect to lead our platform's evolution as we embark on a significant digital transformation journey. This role is pivotal in designing, developing, and implementing innovative Salesforce solutions that drive business growth and enhance customer experiences. The ideal candidate will have a proven track record in architecting complex Salesforce environments, particularly within Sales and Service Clouds, and a deep understanding of platform capabilities to support a growing user base of over 450 users.
   

  

**Your responsibilities will include:**
* Develop and execute the overall Salesforce architecture strategy, aligning with business objectives and digital transformation initiatives.
* Lead the design, development, and implementation of complex Salesforce solutions across Sales and Service Clouds.
* Optimize Salesforce performance, scalability, and security to support a growing user base.
* Ensure data integrity and governance across the Salesforce platform.
* Lead and mentor a team of Salesforce developers and administrators, fostering a culture of continuous learning and innovation.
* Stay up-to-date with Salesforce product releases and industry trends to drive continuous improvement.
* Act as a point of escalation for complex Salesforce issues, providing expert-level troubleshooting and resolution.


**We are seeking a candidate with:**
* Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field. Advanced degree preferred.
* 7+ years of hands-on Salesforce experience, including Sales Cloud and Service Cloud.
* Proven experience as a Salesforce Architect with a strong portfolio of successful implementations.
* Extensive experience with Salesforce integrations, data migration, and custom development.
* Expert knowledge of Salesforce platform, including Apex, Visualforce, Lightning Components, and SOQL.
* Proficient in Salesforce integration patterns, including REST/SOAP APIs, middleware solutions, and third-party integrations.
* Strong understanding of Salesforce data security, governance, and compliance best practices.
* Familiarity with Agile methodologies
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to articulate complex technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders.
* Strong leadership abilities with a proven track record of mentoring and leading technical teams.
* Strategic thinker with a proactive approach to problem-solving and innovation.


 By joining our team, you will have the opportunity to make a significant impact on our business and shape the future of our Salesforce platform.
   

  

**Next step:**
 Please address your questions to Mikaela Nilsson (mikaela.nilsson@tobiidynavox.com) and submit your resume (only in English) or LinkedIn profile through our website. We're looking forward to your application!
   

  

**Where we stand:**
 We believe diversity not only enriches our workplace culture, but also gives us a strategic advantage. Working with people from a variety of backgrounds and perspectives helps us all become better communicators, better problem solvers, and better human beings. Our differences make us stronger.
   

  

 Tobii Dynavox values equality of opportunity, human dignity, and racial/ethnic and cultural diversity. Tobii Dynavox does not discriminate against individuals on the basis of race, color, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, religion, disability, age, veteran status, ancestry, or national or ethnic origin.

title: Supporttekniker på deltid!
description:
Vi söker just nu två engagerade och utåtriktade studenter för ett deltidsuppdrag fram till sommaren 2025. Vi ser gärna att du som kandidat vill ta ägandeskap för ditt arbete, besitter ett starkt inre driv och en vilja att utvecklas, både i rollen och som en del av teamet!
 



  

**Plats :**
 Danderyd
 



  

**Jobbkategori :**
 IT
 



  

**Omfattning :**
 Deltid, cirka 20 tim/vecka
 



  

**Startdatum :**
 Omgående
 



  

**Typ av uppdrag :**
 Konsultuppdrag
   




**Om tjänsten**

 Vår kund är en ledande aktör inom medicinteknik och e-hälsolösningar som utvecklar teknik som effektiviserar vårdflöden globalt - detta är din chans att vara med och bidra till en produkt som direkt hjälper vården och dina medmänniskor! Trots deras ledande position på marknaden är de ett mindre bolag med cirka 30-40 anställda där avdelningarna jobbar nära och samarbetar med varandra. Bolaget genomgår just nu en nyuppbyggnad med en tydlig vision att sträva framåt i sin utveckling och struktur!
 


  


  

**Du erbjuds**



  

  
* Ett konsultuppdrag på deltid - cirka 20 tim/vecka (50%). Det initiala uppdraget beräknas pågå till juni 2025 men det finns möjlighet till förlängning även under och efter sommaren.
  
* En fadder på plats som ansvarar för upplärning och on-boarding av teknikerna
  
* En dedikerad konsultchef som finns tillgänglig för bland annat stöttning i karriären
  

  


**Arbetsuppgifter**
  
* Ärendehantering och support
  
* Felsökning
  
* IT-drift och underhåll
  
* Systeminstallation- och uppdateringar
  
* Kundkontakt och fältsupport - fysiska besök ute hos kund för att uppdatera mjukvara
  

  


**Vi söker dig som**
  
* Är studerande på eftergymnasial nivå på minst 50% med examen tidigast sommaren 2025.
  
* Har ett stort intresse för IT och service
  
* Har B-körkort (manuell)
  
* Kan kommunicera professionellt på svenska och obehindrat på engelska.
  


  


  

**Det är meriterande om du har**



  

  
* Studerar en eftergymnasial utbildning mot IT- eller datavetenskap
  
* Erfarenhet av att ha arbetat med eller mot regioner
   

 Kunskap kan erhållas genom utbildning, erfarenhet eller att vara självlärd.
  


  


  

**För att lyckas i rollen har du följande personliga egenskaper:**



  

  
* Kommunikativ
  
* Självgående
  
* Flexibel
  
* Samarbetsinriktad
  


  

  

**Vår rekryteringsprocess**
  


 Denna rekryteringsprocess hanteras av Academic Work och vår kunds önskemål är att alla frågor rörande tjänsten skickas till Academic Work.
 


  


 Vi tillämpar löpande urval och kommer plocka ner annonsen när tillräckligt många kandidater har nått slutskedet i rekryteringsprocessen. Rekryteringsprocessen innehåller två urvalstest: ett personlighetstest och ett test i kognitiv förmåga. Testerna är ett verktyg för att kunna hitta den kandidat med högst potential för tjänsten samt främja jämlikhet, mångfald och en rättvis rekryteringsprocess.
   




**Bli en del av Academic Work**

 Som konsult för Academic Work erbjuds du stora möjligheter att växa professionellt och knyta värdefulla kontakter för framtiden. Du får en konsultchef som stöttar dig under resans gång och får ta del av olika förmåner, bl.a. möjlighet till kompetensutveckling i form av en grundläggande hållbarhetsutbildning.
 


 Läs mer om vårt konsulterbjudande här
   

**Har du frågor om tjänsten?**

 Agnes Lekenhed eller någon av kollegorna i rekryteringsteamet svarar dig gärna på stv2@academicwork.se Ange annons-ID i ditt mail: 15108157

title: Unit Quality Leader
description:
**Help us shape the future of mobility**
----------------------------------------

  

  

At Volvo Cars, we’re on an exciting journey to shape the future of mobility. We’re building direct relationships with customers, and aim to be a leader in new technology. It’s so exciting – we’re well on our way on our journey towards full electrification. Join us and become a part of our vision for the future – a future that's both exciting and a catalyst for positive change.

  


**Do you want to join us?**  



Are you an experienced Software Quality Engineer or a development engineer with good leadership skills and ready for a new challenge?

  


We are dedicated to electrifying our brand in a broad effort with Plug-In Hybrids (PHEVs) and Battery Electric Vehicles (BEVs). At Vehicle Propulsion, we are responsible for design and delivery of the technical solutions of Battery Systems, Electric Drive and Power Supply for electrified vehicles. We cover the complete product development of mechanical, electrical and software components.

  

As **Software Quality Assurance Engineer** within the group Forward Model Quality, you will be responsible to assess (measure) the quality of work products and facilitate that potential SW quality problems are identified as early as possible in the development process both for in house development teams and supplier.  



  

**Main responsibilities**  



* Assure that the defined SW processes and methods are used and that their related work products (such as requirement documents, plans etc.) are developed with intended quality
* Proactively act and recommend activities and decisions that affect the project’s ability to reach defined targets.
* Support the Project Leaders to identify and manage the items and assignments that lead to that the project’s quality targets, checkpoints and key activities are fulfilled
* Provide internal training in SW Engineering and Quality Assurance where needed
* Review processes, procedures, templates, and report deviations and lacks in the definition of processes, procedures etc.
* Assist in maintenance and development of processes, procedures, templates etc.

  




**You and your skills**

  


You prefer an analytical, structured and open-minded way of working. You will use your communication and teamwork skills when building networks.

  


* B.Sc. in Mechatronics, Automation or equivalent. M.Sc. is considered meritorious
* Experience from software development methodology.
* Fluent in English, written and spoken
* Ability to drive change and implementation
* Engaged and ability to encourage people

  


**Meritorious**


* Profound knowledge of SW and/or HW engineering
* Quality Assurance experience
* Knowledge of SW maturity models (e.g. Automotive SPICE)



**Ready to Take the Next Step?**
---------------------------------

  

  

Please submit your application through our career page. Due to GDPR regulations, we’re unable to store or consider applications from other platforms. Make sure to submit your application in English.

  

  

Once your application is successfully submitted, you’ll receive a confirmation email. We’re excited to get to know you!

  



**Volvo Cars – driving change together**
-----------------------------------------

  

  

Volvo Cars’ success is the result of a collaborative, diverse and inclusive working environment. Today, we’re one of the most well-known and respected car brands, with around 43,000 employees across the globe. At Volvo Cars, your career is designed around your skills and aspirations, so you can reach your fullest potential.  

  

And it’s so exciting – we’re well on our way on our journey towards full electrification. We have five fully electric cars already on the market, and five more on the way. Our fully-electric and plug-in hybrid cars combined make up almost 50 per cent of our sales. So come and join us in shaping the future of mobility. There’s never been a more rewarding time to play your part in our inspiring and creative teams!  



Curious about Life at Volvo Cars? Read more


Curious about our story? Read more

title: Konsultuppdrag | AI Engineer
description:
**Söker för en av våra kunder räkning en AI Engineer.**  

  

**Svensktalande är prioriterat**

**Hybrid i Stockholm.**

 **Main Responsibilities**

* Design, develop, and maintain AI-based systems using the latest technologies, such as large language models (LLM), Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG), AI agents, and AI pipelines.
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure AI solutions align with customer needs and business objectives.
* Contribute to shaping long-term AI strategy and development.

**What We’re Looking For**


To thrive in this role, you likely have the following qualifications:

* At least 5 years of experience in software development
* Strong proficiency in Python
* At least 2 years of experience working with modern AI technologies, including large language models, AI pipelines, and agents.
* A strong interest in AI innovation and experience designing and implementing AI solutions.
* Experience in data engineering is a plus.

 **Om oss**

*Senterprise Consulting är ett eget affärsområde inom Senterprise Sverige och är en ledande oberoende förmedlare av frilansande konsulter.*  

*Genom aktiv headhunting och search och en omfattande teknisk förståelse hjälper Senterprise Sverige de främsta arbetsgivarna att hitta de mest lämpade kandidaterna för både anställning och konsultbehov.*  

*Läs vidare på* *www.senterprise.se*

title: System Designer
description:
**Can you engineer a brighter tomorrow?**
-----------------------------------------

  

  

It’s crystal clear: the actions we take in the next few years will significantly impact our future. At Volvo Cars, we embrace change. We’re committed to transforming the automotive industry and leading in electrification. For this, we’re seeking out more creative minds to shape that future. Don’t miss this opportunity to create your tomorrow.

  


**Let's introduce ourselves**
-----------------------------



We explore the next generation of personal, sustainable, and safe Volvo cars. Volvo Cars are now in the making of a completely new platform to support fully electric, self-driving and connected cars. The heart of the car will be a Core Computer to control the vast amount of innovative functionality and systems in the car. This new design will be present in many future Volvo cars. This will be an important cornerstone for the company to be competitive in the fast-paced transformation of the previous traditional car industry going all electric.


**What you'll do**
------------------



You will be part of our System Management team which consists of senior system architects and developers. The team is governing the High-Performance system architecture of our Core Computer and supports architects and developers across the organization to design, develop and deliver high quality software meeting our system requirements and constraints. The team is working in various domains, including SW architectural design, system configuration, performance optimization, tooling, and visualization. The team aims to make our evolving application stack meet the multitude of non-functional requirements on a complex embedded high performant system. The team is a cornerstone in Volvo Cars transition into a software driven company.


Our department at large is working with many different areas from car feature development, SW architectural design, SW build tools, CI pipelines and system analysis. The teams are working in an agile way, with great independence, ownership, and trust. We have a warm and relaxed atmosphere where you will be an important contributor to the team. Our software will run on emulators as well as hardware rigs and finally the car itself. You will have a key role in the building of the next generation of Volvo cars.  



**Job Responsibilities:**


* **Application Software Development 6:** Develop existing applications and contribute to development of new applications by analyzing and identifying areas for modification and improvement. Develop new routine applications to meet customer requirements.
* **Applications Software Maintenance 6:** Monitor, identify, and correct more complex software defects to maintain fully functioning applications software.
* **Design and Conceptualization 5:** Research and interpret data, trends, and benchmarks relevant to digital products/services design.
* **Websites/Portals Maintenance and Update 6:** Design and oversee the functionality, usability, and accessibility of business-critical portals/websites using content creation and management tools as well as digital media to ensure that technical continuity is maintained and development standards are met.
* **Technical Developments Recommendation 5:** Research and suggest technical developments to improve the quality of the website/portal/software and supporting infrastructure to better meet usersï¿½ needs.
**What you'll bring**
---------------------



You are a software designer with a curious approach to new challenges. You can switch focus between the big picture and technical details when required. You have experience in system configuration, providing solutions fitting a multitude of use cases. You enjoy great teamwork and are proactive, creative, and willing to share your experience and knowledge. You are entrepreneurial and have the capacity to drive issues in cooperation with our stakeholders. You can also navigate your way through ambiguous and undefined problems. Solid communication skills, both in written form and in face-to-face meetings are important skills you should possess.


You have a Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or equivalent. You are self-going with at least 5 years of experience in software development.


You have:  

* The skills and experience to reason about medium/large scale software systems
* Experience in system configuration
* Solid communication skills.
* Proficiency in Python

Nice to have:  

* Experience in embedded systems
* Worked in Configuration Management
* Proficiency in modern C++ and YAML experience
* Experience in the automotive industry
* Knowledge in Functional Safety and Cyber Security

**Ready to Take the Next Step?**
---------------------------------

  

  

Please submit your application through our career page. Due to GDPR regulations, we’re unable to store or consider applications from other platforms. Make sure to submit your application in English.


If you have any questions about the recruitment process, you are welcome to reach out to Recruiter Sofia Belén Grosso at sofia.grosso@volvocars.com. For specific questions about the position, please reach out to Hiring Manager Mattias Ericsson at mattias.ericsson.2@volvocars.com.

  



**Volvo Cars – driving change together**
-----------------------------------------

  

  

Volvo Cars’ success is the result of a collaborative, diverse and inclusive working environment. Today, we’re one of the most well-known and respected car brands, with around 43,000 employees across the globe. At Volvo Cars, your career is designed around your skills and aspirations, so you can reach your fullest potential.


And it’s so exciting – we’re well on our way on our journey towards full electrification. We have five fully electric cars already on the market, and five more on the way. Our fully-electric and plug-in hybrid cars combined make up almost 50 per cent of our sales. So come and join us in shaping the future of mobility. There’s never been a more rewarding time to play your part in our inspiring and creative teams!
company_description: At Volvo Car Group, our vision is clear: "To be the world's most progressive and desired premium car brand".

title: HIL Engineer Verification and validation
description:
**Automotive verification engineers with a HIL backgroun** **d**  

  

**You will be working in the cutting edge of SW testing within verification and validation for our market leader partners within automotive. You will be working in a fast moving, highly adapting environment, with short loops to ensure steady flow of testing. We are looking for a highly motivated engineer who wants to join our HIL development team.**  

  

**You:**  

  

**As a person we believe you are comfortable with working both in a dynamic team with people from all parts of the world and alone as a self-sufficient unit delivering on your dependencies. You are of an innovative mindset and like facing new challenges within your work. You like tinkering with electronics and have hands-on experience from working with hardware. You will have worked within the automotive domain or similar for at least four years.**  

  

**Key responsibilities:**

* **Design, implement and optimize HIL test environments**
* **Collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure seamless integration of software components**
* **Conduct testing to validate and verify SW/HW performance**
* **Analyze and troubleshoot issues, providing effective solutions to enhance system reliability**
* **Assist Verification Engineers and developers to effectively use the HIL**
**Qualifications**
------------------

* **Master’s degree in engineering (Electronics, Mechatronics, Mechanics or Physics) or equivalent**
* **At least 4+ years of experience with HIL or SIL test environment development**
* **Continuous integration / Continuous deployment experience**
* **Proven experience in working with dSPACE Tools: ControlDesk, ModelDesk, MotionDesk and ConfigurationDesk**
* **Vector tools experience with one or several applications: CANoe, CANalyzer, CANape, CAPL**
* **Knowledge in vehicle communication such as CAN,LIN, Flexray, Ethernet and UDS**
* **Experience in simulating Electrical faults on HIL**
* **Driven, team-oriented and self-motivated person with a technical mind-set**
* **Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail**
* **Excellent communication and documentation skills**

  

**Meritorious:**

* **Worked for an Automotive OEM manufacturer**
* **Hands-on HIL building experience and working with hardware**
* **Experience in MATLAB/Simulink, m script.**
* **Experience in at least one of the following languages: C / C++ / Python**
* **Experience of setting up and improving a CI/CD flow**
* **Leadership experience**
* **Relentless quality and performance driver**
* **Driver’s license**

**Application and contact**  

**Selection and interviews are running continuously.**  

**Apply now since we assign roles during the whole application time span.For questions and for more information contact Jan Hansson, Talent Acquisition Partner, 0725-616900**  

  

**Kindly note that due to GDPR, we will not accept applications via mail. Please use our career site.**  

  

**We kindly but firmly refrain from direct contact with staffing, brokerage, and recruitment companies as well as other external actors and sellers of additional job advertisements.**
